DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT it is not seamless, not intuitive and after you spend your hard earned money you will NOT be able to use your amazon firestick to log into the product you legally purchased. For the love of god do not buy this product. It is a huge waste of money, fubo should be working tirelessly, it is the world cup and they would get a massive following if they offered a great product, but they can not offer this product they want to laugh as my brasilian family weeps.

1.  Pricing is deceptive.  Advertised at $54.99 but you are forced to take 2 add-ons at signup that increases price to $59.99.  2.  Large portion of the channels air classic TV.  Can get these for free with other apps.  3.  Experienced technical issues.  One time the audio began repeating. Tried changing channel,  closing app, turning off fire stick, unplug fire stick from tv, etc.  Audio continued.  Was like a horror movie.  Finally unplugged fire stick from outlet.  That worked.  Another time both TVs suddenly displayed a message that we had reached maximum devices.  Plan allowed 3.  Only 2 even had the app.  Same day,  little Later, streaming stopped during a live broadcast.  Was 10 minutes before I could get program back on.  Horrible 5 day experience.

I'm currently in the FuboTV seven day trial. Thus far, I've found a few bugs in the Fire TV app. (At least, if you're using the Fire TV Game Controller.) Pause, fast forward and reverse do not work. On the game controller, pressing the "A" button pauses Amazon, Sling, DirecTV Now and Playstation Vue playback. It does not, however, work with Fubo. Additionally, if you exit playback mid-program, there is no "resume" feature. Conversely, playback on a PC has no problems whatsoever. I just much prefer watching TV on an actual TV. (And yeah, I know, I can "cast" from my computer.)DVR recordings are limited to only 10. That's something I can live with because I'm only recording motorcycle racing on Bein Sports. That said, if I was using Fubo as my primary streaming service, that would be a deal breaker.As for image/video quality, there are no issues. It's on par with all of the other streaming services (aside from Amazon with their AMAZING UHD 4K playback.)I suspect FuboTV will fix their Fire TV app quickly, so I'll probably try them again in a few months. They are definitely on the right track, but the Fire TV app is certainly in its infancy.

Buffering issues!! this is the real deal breaker!!!and way to many unused channels that are being counted as "total channels" plus not all content is not HD,If I wanted standard definition I'd get basic cable. Interface is horrible, useless guide if you cannot select channel's from it.I've tried just about all online streaming services, playstation vue,sling,hulu and now fubotv. Buffering with fubotv is nowhere near as bad as hulu but it's a close second, also they advertise 70+ channel's however a lot of these are not being used, it's more like 40-50 channel's.

Headings: Flasely Advertised the Eagles vs Cowboys Game
Base_Reviews: It was advertised on Google search engine that the Eagles vs Cowboys game could be viewed on FuboTV. After signing up for the free trial, logged into the website and could not find the games broadcast on a search on the FuboTV website. I immediately cancelled the free trial subscription and after cancelling, I still continue to get emails about their services and links to reactivate the service. I have emailed them to confirm my cancellation (no response) and requested that no further contacted is needed because I do not deal with any company that advertises one thing and does not provide the actual solicited service. If the game that I was looking to view was blacked out or not available, it should have been indicated in the advertisement. I signed up and provided my credit card for services that were not provided. FuboTV completely wasted my time and after I cancelled the service, I am still receiving emails stating: Your trial is still activeIf you're no longer interested in watching fuboTV and you'd like to end your trial early, visit 'My Account Page' and click 'Cancel Subscription' and follow the steps to cancel. To visit 'My Account Page', click here.I have already cancelled FuboTV and not interested in hearing from FuboTV since I missed watching the game I wanted to watch already.

Headings: terrible user interface, unreliable streaming, slow to connect, lower res "HD"
Base_Reviews: Boy do I regret believing the reviews on Fubo.  Yes, they have some sports coverage that's hard to get elsewhere.  But it's not worth it.Firstly the user interface is really really bad.  Who designed this thing?  It's clunky, allows very little customization, gives limited information about shows, makes it difficult to change channels, etc. etc.Then you find that it takes some time after you switch to a new channel to get a non-blurry picture.  What?  Are you running this out of your basement, Fubo?And every so often there's an outage.  Unexplained and usually unreported, but there you go, you can't get that stream now.  Has happened to me more than once, and usually right when there was a "I don't want to miss this" event.  I've stopped keeping track.Finally, all the so-called HD streams are really at 720p, not 1080p.  There's one "experimental" 4K channel, rarely has anything on it.Yeah, I've already cancelled my service, just waiting for the current sub to drain.  (Yes, drain is the right term.)  I'm considering Hulu -- it has most of the channels I want, and works well with Fire boxes. I'll miss the occasional La Liga and Ligue 1 and Serie A matches I was able to catch, but I can't justify Fubo for access to the few games I have time to watch.

Headings: Bait and Switch on the Free Trial
Base_Reviews: I signed up for a 7 day free trial of Fubo.tv to test it out using my AmazonFireTV service. I wanted to review the channel lineup and the UI to see if it was a good cable TV alternative. When I signed up it asks for a credit card but says that only $1.00 will be charged. I signed up and moved on with the testing. Three days later I canceled the service and decided to go with another provider, but I had already been billed in full for the month.I contacted support and they told me that I already had an account. I had completely forgotten that 2+ years ago I did a free trial as well and didn't like it. If they had told me I didn't qualify when I signed up I wouldn't have signed up for the free trial. It said it would charge only $1.00 and then proceeded to charge me $45. Don't fall for this bait and switch.The UI is terrible anyway so I would advise others not to sign up. It's very difficult to use and the only good thing they offer is BeinSports.

Headings: Junk doesn't work and bilks you after you cancel
Base_Reviews: This has to be the crappiest app I have ever downloaded for streaming. It froze up every 20 seconds, did not have the BS how's to watch on channels you you pay for, reduced quality picture . Just a horrible experience. This App makes Amazon look bad. I'm still ticked off I paid for a month of service and received about 30 minutes of crashing d streaming. Amazon needs ton dump this app off their firestick

Headings: I don't regret my choice, after the fact.
Base_Reviews: I find the service good.  This change has reduced my bill substantially.  My bill will be $100.00 less per month all-in (that reduction takes into account that I have added services that I did not previously have - add-ons to FUBO).  I did not have the top of the line cable service from my provider.  Instead I had the third best out of four options from my provider.Is it more complicated than cable TV? Change means adjustment to a different format.  The learning curve is not overwhelming.  For those not well versed with changes in TV services I would recommend getting a younger family members assistance to make the change.  I chose to load FUBO via the Amazon Fire platform.  After the fact I found out that I cannot watch HBO on Amazon's platform.  I can stream it on my iPhone and iPad, as it can be streamed on other devices.  That is inconvenient, but not a deal breaker.  Solution, use the Apple TV platform, the Youtube's platform or I believe ROKU's platform.Note: the number of channels I had access to on cable totaled 220.  On FUBO it is substantially less.  For me this was not a problem, as I complemented what FUBO offers me with HPO and Disney (still I have the stated cost reduction).  I also have Netflix and am an Amazon Prime member, which I had before I left the cable service.  I have more than I have any possibility of ever watching.Best part of this change?  I no longer have a contract.  I can switch any or all of the services I have from one month to the next.

Headings: Don't bother if you have Amazon Fire TV
Base_Reviews: Amazon Fire TV implementation is terrible. No entry for "Settings" at the top. The navigation between features is much less useful than any other alternative internet TV offering that I've seen. Like when you press the menu button on Playstation Vue, you see the current show, the next couple of shows, and can switch to the Guide if you want. On Fubo, you press the menu button and you can change the video resolution, worthless. They really need to work on navigation for users with Fire TV. About the only thing that you get for live TV are select, the arrow buttons, and return. I assume the Roku is much better, not going to pay $100 to find out, though. The only plus is that the local stations seem to work well. Not the stuttering that I see on Playstation Vue local channel, or all the myriad of problems with the local stations on Hulu with Live TV. But the navigation with Fire TV is so bad, I can't use it.What I'd really like to do is rearrange the guide to put all the sports channels together at the bottom of the guide, instead of having some at the top, and another group at the bottom. Really wacky the way that the channels are arranged. Some are alphabetical like you'd like (the non-sports ones), and the sports channels are just disorganized.But in the end it doesn't matter. Unless I can find another way to use this app without the Fire TV, ain't going to happen.

Headings: Some Problems But No Show Stoppers
Base_Reviews: I must say from the start that the only reason I purchased this app for to watch the Giro d'Italia (Italy's version of the Tour de France). I use NBC Sports Gold to watch cycling but the Giro was not a covered race. A quick Google search led me to fubotv. I primarily watch TV through FireTV so I downloaded the fubotv app and then subscribed through my computer. I have been using fubotv for less than a week. Based upon that experience I offer the following observations.I am able to watch the Giro as I desired. There are quite a few other channels available but I have not watch any, for reasons to be discussed below. The picture quality is fine and as with all internet apps it is dependent on you internet speed/quality.My biggest disappointment is the limited capacity of the "DVR" feature. While it is true you can "record" shows for later viewing you are limited to three "recording" total. Also, you must watch those recording within 72 hours of there recording, after which they will be deleted. This limitation has prevented me from recording any thing other than the Giro (which is a 21 day race) which explains why I have on experience with other channels. This wouldn't be too bad except the DVR does not provide the ability to record a "season". Rather, I have to go the desktop each day and set the DVR to record the next program (in my case, the next race three days in the future). A "Season" or "Record All" option sure would be nice.Another limitation, at least from the FireTV standpoint, is that you can't set the DVR to record a show from your TV. You can access the DVR to play a recording but to set new recordings you must use a computer. Also, the schedule on the FireTV fubotv app is limited to about 12 hours in the future.Finally, I have noticed that when the app is paused and then resumed there is a lot of buffering time before the show starts again. I don't believe this is a ISP problem as the buffering is much longer than with PBS, NBC Sports Gold, HBO Now or YouTube.Bottom line, I am pleased to be able to watch the Giro "legally". The fubotv allows me to do this. The grips above are really are more observations than show stoppers. With that said, to get cycling with the DVR feature I am paying more than $40 per month. I will cancel my subscription after the Giro is done, not because of the app but because I really don't have any interest in the other channels. If fubotv offers some programming that your looking for I would go for it.

Fubo has lots of channels and gave me the option of adding on the NFL network.  The streaming works fine on my TCL Roku TVs and the only drawback I see so far is much of the content is in 720p and not true HD. Also 4k content is very limited. Sometimes they broadcast Fox NFL games in 4k. My TCL struggles with that channel but my Amazon fire tv works fine with Fox NFL 4k. With the Fubo app, I can install it on my iphone and all my apple devices so I can watch tv anywhere.  You can even stream it on a Windows laptop through the website.I did the free week trial before I finally selected Fubo as I didn't know anyone using the service so I was skeptical. We're saving about $100 a month by cancelling Comcast's phone and cable.  For the savings, I can put up with the lower resolution.

Headings: Everything was working fine for a few minutes then the app crashed
Base_Reviews: I downloaded this app to watch the Peru vs Colombian soccer match on October 10. Everything was working fine for a few minutes then the app crashed. For the WHOLE game!. I had people over my house very upset at the situation!. I contacted the support team and they said that there were too many people streaming the game and the application crashed. This is not a good excuse! FIFA qualifier games and FIFA matches overall have a huge volume of viewers specially if the game is not being shown on a regular TV network and the application developers need to be prepared to satisfy that need special if people are paying for a membership!.......Now I don't know if can rely on this app and invite people to my watch because I don't know if it'll work.

This was the worst app I have ever encountered. I could never get on. When I tried to get help there was no place to email or contact  the website just kept directing me to their help site. They had a phone number you could call but it kept rolling over and making me choose an option every five minutes. Needless to say, I chose this app to see a football game, and I started one hour early to do so,  and I never got to see any of the game. I donÃ¢â¬â¢t even know who to contact to get out of my trial period.Horrible horrible customer service. I will be surprised if anyone actually subscribes to this service.

Headings: FuboTV repeatedly charged my credit card - User Beware
Base_Reviews: Do NOT use FuboTV! I signed up for their free trial access and canceled the same day because they hardly any of my MLS games. The next month, out of the blue, they started randomly charging my credit card (which you had to give them for the free trail.) There was one charge for $384 from FuboTV!! I emailed their support immediately. They replied that they see the charges but needed my expiration date on my CC repeatedly to confirm. I wasn't going to give them any more CC info, so I went to my CC company to dispute the charges and they blocked FuboTV from any further activity. I can surmise that either they got hacked and didn't want to own it, or they are involved in illicit behavior. Either way, their "support" was not willing to do anything about it, even though they saw the problem. User Beware!

We did a one week trial during the World Series.  It was a little more difficult to set up than expected, but only took about 15 minutes, I guess.  At one point, we were just watching the video, and the stream just paused.  Did a netspeed test on my phone, and we had 200mbps download...stream still paused.  Had to restart the stream to get it going again.  Took about 5 minutes.  Also, the second time we started it up no audio, switched to Netflix and the audio popped in, then back to fubo and there was audio.For $65/mo I would just expect a better interface.  Enjoyed games 5 and 6 of the series, but then cancelled right away.  For the price, definitely not for us.

Headings: Useless. I bought it because I wanted to watch ...
Base_Reviews: Useless. I bought it because I wanted to watch an important soccer game for World Cup qualifiers. It crashed down and could not see even any channel at all. It kept saying that I didn't have network and yet my other apps like Sling or Amazon were fine. I understand that this happen to many people too. First Bad impressions are difficult to forget.

I recently moved and have been unable to get suddenlink cable or directv or dish satellite services to provide service at my location (too many trees for satellite and the cable company is a joke, won't even provide a quote to extend service) so I began exploring cable alternatives.  FuboTv has a great selection of channels and it works on the devices I have.  The stream quality has been decent with the limited bandwidth I have (approx. 15mbps) and the picture quality is good most of the time.  I suspect this has more to do with my internet provider than it does the FuboTV service, I will try to update when my speeds get an upgrade in a month or so.  The cost isn't bad, but when compared to other services, it is probably about $10/month higher than it should be.  I WOULD recommend this to others as a good cable/satellite alternative.

Headings: Can not fast forward or rewind on FireTV or Roku
Base_Reviews: First of all pros:1. Better Live streaming quality than Hulu. Last year I tried both for watching World Cup and Fubo was the clear winner.2. Lots of soccer Live streamingThe thing I don't like:1. Fast forward and rewind are not available on FireTV or Roku. It can be done on cell phone or lap top so it is not a technical issue.This is super painful because some of the video on demand sports contents have more than one hour extra recording before the real game start. I have to wait patiently for > one hour to watch a game. On the bright side, they just added "Resume" function recently. Before that if someone accidentally exit the game I would have to wait again. This is very inconsiderate and makes me want to drop.2. No ABC - This is not a blocker because I can switch to antenna to watch NBA, Oscar, etc.3. Recent some of the soccer games such as Woman World Cup by Telemundo are streamed at 960x540 with wrong aspect ratio. Video is letterboxed and players are squeezed short vertically.*Update on 7/8/2019 This issue has been resolved.4. Ads. Sometimes Ads does not work properly. For example, I was watching the TV show Heros, Ads started, indicating it is going to play 4 ads. the first ad played twice. then after the 3rd ad (Xfinity ad with two turtles), it went back to Ad 1. This cycle repeated again and again without moving on. In the end I had to give up on that show.

Headings: Too many sports channel but will try for a month
Base_Reviews: So after using Att TV for a year, I wanted to try another service because AttÃ¢â¬â¢s app glitches quite often and can be slow to open the channels at times. IÃ¢â¬â¢ve been using Fubo for about 2 weeks now. It has most of the channels that I need but too many sports channel for me. I wish there was a package that did not include so many. Tried calling the customer service number 3 times already, each time 30 minutes wait per recording still didnÃ¢â¬â¢t get anyone, perhaps change the recording que to call us back instead of holding other companies do that. I also wish it recalled the most recent channels watched for Channel surfers like myself.thatÃ¢â¬â¢s one of the features I like on the Att TV app. Maybe there is a way to do it but I canÃ¢â¬â¢t get anyone on the line to assist. IÃ¢â¬â¢ll see how it goes for the next month.

Headings: Lagging compared to other devices that are streaming with Fubo
Base_Reviews: The fubo TV app as a whole is the same across devices, I have it on iphone and ipad and the experience is the same. However, the fubo TV app on the fire stick lags about 20-25 seconds compared to having the same stream on iphone or ipad. Considering that the iphone/ipad are 10-15 secs behind a TV provider like spectrum, it makes it hard to view live sports so far behind. I am okay with 10-15 seconds behind but not 35-40 secs behind. If the Fubo guys can fix this and make all devices have the stream at the same time it would be awesome. For now, I am still using the lighting to hdmi converter and using my ipad to view fuboTV on the big screen.

Headings: There's a Sneaky Catch to This Service.
Base_Reviews: I think FuboTv is a very good service that provides great channels, including MSG so I can watch my Devils lose mercilessly every other day, BUT!!!!! Beware, there's a sneaky stipulation to their service.  You are unable to stream FuboTV on 2 devices at the same time if you are on 2 different wifi networks.  Example: my sister has a house and I have a house.  The home network is my house, therefore if she wants to watch fubo on a roku/firestick/ smart tv app/ apple tv / xbox at her house while im watching it at my house it is not allowed. This rule only applies to TV Devices.  So in that case she or I would need to stop using the firestick to watch fubo and start watching on our phones or laptops.  Extremely inconvenient for people using the same account in 2 different homes.  I spoke to fubo about it and they said there's nothing they can do and it's part of their contract.They need to make it so that we can pay maybe like $5 extra per month to add a TV Device outside of the home network cuz this is going to make me cancel their service.

Headings: So glad there was a free trial
Base_Reviews: The interface was confusing to me as a first time user which was a huge turnoff. There just simply wasn't enough value for me to pay $45 every month. I have live TV through a different service at $20/month and since it includes ESPN, I get the majority of sporting events that I like. I would not recommend this service.

This is an extremely expensive streaming service. BTW, they don't carry ABC as a local. Plenty of Euro football though. 59.99 a month is ridiculous. Streaming services are slowly creeping up to cable prices. Stop them. Don't buy this content. There are other services, like Sling, which is much more affordable. Doing doesn't carry local stations but a decent antenna will solve that problem for you.

Headings: Disney apps did not come without a problem
Base_Reviews: I like the fact that they added new channels in Aug 1 2020, but these new channels still to this writing 08/23/20 are not able to record, nor can you see any past shows on them. You can only watch them live.  These channels are Espn, NatgeoWild, National Geographic, espn2, espnNews, espnU, ACCN, SECespn, ABCNewsLive, CBSN, Disney, disney jr, XD, FX , FXM,, FXX,  They have promised this would be fixed, but this is the second time Fubo has told me that it would be fixed within a week but it still hasn't happened.  I wish their customer service would communicate and update us when this will be fixed.  I will update you when this finally happens.  I use the 4K Firestick.

Headings: Problems with receiving channels & out of market games
Base_Reviews: I tried FUBO tv. I first problem was I could not get out of market NFL games. The second problem I could not get ESPN. I contacted their technical support spent 55 minutes on phone, he could not fix the problem. He said the he would elevate the support call. Did not here back from support. Cancelled service. The problem was that when I went  into ESPN, I would just have spinning circle and then get rebooted out the FUBO, then would screwup Fire TV.When I uninstalled the APP, rebooted, everything went back to normal and has been working great!

Headings: If you have time to deal with all these inconveniences and miss the sporting events you really want towatch, then this is a good
Base_Reviews: Not reliable application. Live streaming LAGS during main sports event (Real Madrid vs Barcelona),  DVR records wrong events (requested to record Mexico vs Jamaica, recorded a boxing fight), becomes unresponsive even if application is deleted and reinstalled. When you ask for technical assistance, you are ALWAYS told to delete and reinstall app and to check with your internet provider, contact your device vendor (i.e. Amazon, Chromecast, Roku, AppleTv, AndroidTV, etc).  Most viewing issues or wrong DVR recordings are FUBOTV issues. If you have time to deal with all these inconveniences and miss the sporting events you really want to watch, then this is a good app.

Headings: Almost a 5 star if they had ABC
Base_Reviews: I would give this a 5 star but a local channel is missing for me as they have no ABC. But they do have everything else you can think of including the weather channel. (Big one for me in Florida)With all the others either stopping their services or continuing to go up in pricing I landed on Fubo. Not the cheapest and hope they don't start to go up, but I think the best out there. My only wish list is they has their GUI set up so you could have more than one profile so my wife could have her own set of favorites and a little more 4K. But all good otherwise.

If you are looking to watch your home team sports you may want to look else where. My wife is from New England and is, like most of New Englanders, a fan of all their sports teams. I was excited that we had found a streaming app that gave us channels that made her feel at home. She even started to tear up when she saw a Shaw's commercial. Then our world crashed when I checked for the game time on the guide and discovered that all of the New England channels were removed. We were using her hometown zip as our home zip which the website promises that you can watch the regional channels of your home zip even if you aren't physically in that region. This is a lie. I called the support number and the person I talked to contradicted what the website said and keep explaining in circles. When I asked for a supervisor the rep kept trying to talk to me. After I kept repeating I wanted to talk to a supervisor the rep put me on hold and came back approximately 40 seconds later to tell me that a supervisor wasn't available. How convenient!

Headings: I loved it and I cancelled it as soon as I ...
Base_Reviews: I had Sling, I loved it and I cancelled it as soon as I saw FuboÃ¢â¬â¢s list of channels. I didnÃ¢â¬â¢t know you guys existed until two days ago. Exactly the package that I need which Sling, PS Vue, You Tube TV, Hulu, Direct TV Now donÃ¢â¬â¢t provide for this price.Here are my thoughts on the 2nd day IÃ¢â¬â¢m using it. I have 200MB internet speed and a pretty good tech environment at home.Windows version is good.I mostly use, if not all the time Amazon Fire TV. Honestly, it looks like it is in beta version at most.Lots of buffering and pixelation. If youÃ¢â¬â¢re based mostly on sports, this is the most important feature. On live games, it worked better streaming on Chromecast from my phone.Stream Quality is not 1080p and 60hz on most of the channelsNot easy to surf the channels. I have to go back to the list to choose another one, when it should be the option to see whatÃ¢â¬â¢s on the other channels while IÃ¢â¬â¢m on the current one.When I go back to the schedule, it defaults to Fox, the very first channel on the list and I have to scroll all way down if I want to go back to where I was previously watching.To make things worse, when I scroll up and down the list and I click the left side of Fire remote, it selects El Rey by default, no matter where I am. By now IÃ¢â¬â¢m completely lost of where I want to go.Close Captioning are horrible. 1 - There is no way to personalize the fonts, background etc. Too big and cover good part of the screen. 2 Ã¢â¬â They have to be selected on each channel and they donÃ¢â¬â¢t stay on when I change them.DVR is not available on Fire TVOn live sports tab, I clicked on Germany Ã¢â¬â Mexico game and something totally different showed upRW & FF donÃ¢â¬â¢t work.So, it needs some workSince there is no remote with numbers and no numbers assigned to channels, should be some kind of grouping, same as you have for sports. Sorting by News, Movies etc, depending on whatÃ¢â¬â¢s on now and the channel type.Internet version on chrome is way better.It should be an option to add favorite channels and to be able to sort them to our preferences. Scrolling up and down itÃ¢â¬â¢s too much time consuming.IÃ¢â¬â¢ll keep Fubo for couple of months until the next soccer season starts and hopefully things will change, especially streaming quality.If I want buffering and low resolution games, I can find plenty of websites that show them for free.IÃ¢â¬â¢m rooting for you guys. I really, really like what you got going.

It's not the best or worst app for Fire TV. The app is easy enough to navigate, but nothing great. The picture sometimes pixelates or buffers.My main complaint is the FF/RW options! Why are we limited to 15 second skips? It would be far nicer if we could do a standard FF/RW. If I'm somehow missing how to do so, please let me know.Update: Added a star since you can press the FF/RW button repeatedly to add skip time in increments of 15 seconds. I've done as much as 3 minutes. I don't know if there's a limit. It would still be easier to have a regular FF/RW so I could watch any interesting ads.

Headings: Not the best on Fire TV Stick
Base_Reviews: I decided to stick with FuboTV after debating between different live TV streaming services, mostly because of their vast channel lineup, as well as being sports-focused (although the lack of ABC and ESPN is quite glaring). I haven't had any issues with the video quality or frequent buffering as some of the other reviewers, but I have noticed that compared to the FuboTV app on the a device like the Roku, the app on the Fire TV Stick is not as intuitive.First of all, it takes a long time to load, not just the app, but even starting up any channels. The circle will spin for a while before streaming finally begins. Another thing I am not too particularly fond of is the rewinding/fast forwarding capability. It's not very streamlined, and you end up going too far backwards or forwards, and have to keep messing around to get to where you want to be. I wish Fubo could implement a thumbnail system like Sling and YouTube TV so you can see exactly where you are in the program when you're rewinding or fast-forwarding. Once you click play, it takes another long time to load.I personally prefer the Fire TV Stick over Roku, but until FuboTV can incorporate a few more features which will help make the service much more streamlined and easy to use, I will use the FuboTV app on the Roku as it is slightly faster and more responsive.

Yet another service that throws software together overnight and puts it out to the general public to see who bites. They do not have a customer service department. You can not call them. There is a robot that will respond to emails days later that makes you thinks someone is responding. The user interface is poorly designed and they Do Not care to make it better. Just here to collect money. It is really sad that there is not one streaming service out there that is good today, Not one! It's all about collecting that money!

Headings: Buggy app lowers value of subscription
Base_Reviews: FuboTV is functional and may be worth it for you if you have limited options to watch the programming they offer.  The app however could use a lot of improvement to make the service more appealing.  My experience has been the app  freezes from time to time when using the DVR function requiring a forced stop to reset the app. Functionality in DVR and in the program guide is weak.  Streaming slows from time to time causing lower resolution.

Headings: Good quality, TV lineup, lacking in interface functionality.
Base_Reviews: Good TV linup available, excellent streaming at home and mobile. Android TV interface is lacking with an impossible to use fast forward, it skips so fast it's impossible to accurately skip commercials. I would also like to see the ability to select stream quality for the sake of saving data.

Headings: App is good, FuboTV's service is not.
Base_Reviews: Terrible.  I signed up for the free trial to watch the USMNT play in the World Cup Qualifiers.  Feed goes down about 5 min before the match starts and is down until after half time.  Heard plenty of other complaints about how the services tends to crash during big matches.  Their support person running the twitter account seemed overwhelmed and kept suggesting temporary fix that wasn't working either.  They finally sorted out the issues and I did watch the 2nd half of the match on Fubo and it was fine.  Ended up canceling my free trial, so I won't be using this app any more.  As for the App itself, well designed, was fairly easy to navigate and find things.  It ran well until their service crashed.

We got this on the one week free trial to watch the Monday Night Football game. It took the better part of an hour to get it installed and working, only to get an error that said it didn't work on our Apple Fire device even though it was downloaded specifically for that device. We finally had to back out of Apple and go through Roku to get it to work. They are also extremely overpriced for what you get. For the money they charge for their basic service you could get several other channels or regular cable and still have money left over.

Headings: Sling TV does have 2 main packages (Blue & Orange) and if you get Orang Plus sport Extra you will pay $25 for 44 Channels BUT there is a good point with Sling Orange + Sport Extra that you ...
Base_Reviews: I am using it for a week. I compared with Sling TV for sport channels, Fubotv does have more channels and you pay $35 for 76 channels, Sling TV does have 2 main packages (Blue & Orange) and if you get Orang Plus sport Extra you will pay $25 for 44 Channels BUT there is a good point with Sling Orange + Sport Extra that you have  on-demand or featured movies choice that you won't find with Fubotv. I am so happy for having all soccer, NBA, football and UFC channels together.Iif someone is looking for basic national channels plus some sport channels then you may go with Sling's Orange Package for $20. I searched and compared Play Station VUE, HULU, Amazon TV, Sling and Fubo Tv, and pricewise $35 for 76 channels and having all sport channels was the best choice for me.

Headings: FUBO tv look elsewhere for live TV
Base_Reviews: It may let you watch NFL just not Monday night football, my local channels were very laggy and you could not watch for more then about 15 seconds or so without a skip in the picture or audio. The over all picture i think was ok and it was very easy to navigate. It was convienant to watch missed shows, and the recorded playbacks were good with none of the above issues. But i already have a free option for that. Im looking for a "cut the wire" live and local channel option

Mu wife and I decided to try Fubo and so far we love it. The only issue we have encountered is not being able to set our Home location but this is due to our internet provider being LTE based. Other than that the fact that you can get virtually all the channels we had with Dish, you can DVR via the cloud and stream to different devices is a huge plus. If you are not sure about trying I would encourage you to do so, it is not HULU but again you do not see the issues with home location you do with HULU.

I signed up for the free week to give it a try, and to hopefully watch the SuperBowl in 4K HDR streaming quality - Fox Sports was planning to stream a high-res streaming game for the first time. It was not that good an image and it finally kicked into high resolution after about 5 minutes, and then crashed midway through the game. I had it going on two televisions so it was not my set. I also have ATT-Now (formerly DirectTV now) and I switched to that streaming version and it played well and looked sharp (I could not tell if - at their very best - one image was better than the other).I discontinued my Fubo service - I had intended to switch to it to save 15 a month or so - perhaps the demands of an enormous moment were too much for them to meet.

Headings: BIG thumbs up for customer service!
Base_Reviews: No ABC or ESPN means fewer stars. I watch a lot of live sports, and it seems that games are anywhere from ten seconds to over a minute behind cable, but that seems common with streaming services.One very important thing that is FANTASTIC is their customer service. Very extremely impressed with every rep I've spoken with, whether it was a billing or a tech question. Knowledgeable, personable, genuinely helpful. Can't emphasize enough how important that is!

Headings: I'm ditching FuboTv and going to Hulu January 2020
Base_Reviews: Both of my subscriptions were just pre-paid for January but I'm getting rid of Fubo on January 24. The product was ok but had issues with subscriptions from day one. I held on for five months now but am sick and tired of when they update their software that I have to go through and reactivate most of the channels that are included. My current configuration is Firestick TV 4K with Fubo and Sling Orange for ESPN. I should have dropped both of these in September and stuck with Hulu only. I have had multiple FuboTv issues with my subscription especially Showtime and wasn't able to receive or activate multiple channels for weeks. FuboTv SOFTWARE IS BROKEN and desperately needs to be fix.

Headings: Fine if you don't have cable
Base_Reviews: A long way to go before I cut my cable.  Very clutsy interface and not user friendly.  Had lots of pixilation and drop in picture quality.  Support is poor.  NO ABC so my wife hated it.  Some of the games I wanted to watch were not available but I could stream them on my iPad.  Cloud service is basic and problematic -- can't fast forward while recording in session, cant programs until they are scheduled.Thought I hated my cable until this!

Headings: works fairly well  but cannot abide the commercials
Base_Reviews: For the most part this worked very well, a bit confusing about changing channels and viewing options. It was a wake up call as to how bad commercials are and how often they occur. I will not continue and will go back to streaming without commercials. This is not an issue with Fubo but rather an observation of just how bad live TV has become. Most commercials absolutely insult ones intelligence!

Does not work 95% of the time. If you would like to watch this on your firetv stick, understand that under peak load this app will not even start. When this app does work (games no one is interested in) expect lag, poor image quality, and tearing. Autogoooool. Stop wasting our time FuBaRTV.

The product has potential. It has the channels except for Turner channels. But, it you watch a highly watched sports event Fubo doesnÃ¢â¬â¢t have the bandwidth to deliver. You will get several Ã¢â¬ÅweÃ¢â¬â¢re having technical difficultiesÃ¢â¬ï¿½ messages interrupting the game. If you call customer service itÃ¢â¬â¢s an hour on hold to get a person who knows less than the customer. If you email they get back to you in a week. I had to delete and reinstall the app daily for six weeks before giving up. I was running Fubo on a 2020 Nvidia Shield Pro, the fastest streaming device available.

so i signed up for fubo tv, thinking their offerings for streaming would be a great deal. would be if it actually streamed anything. i got slow to no streaming altogether and then if or when the picture actually held, the quality was blurred and unclear. the selection of shows to watch seemed great. but of no use to me if they don't actually stream. hope others have better luck than i did.

Headings: not the Answer unless you like missing 4th quarters, 3rd period, 9 innings or 2nd halves
Base_Reviews: I MEAN 7TH GAME OF THE WORLD SERIES AND IT GOES TO OTHER PROGRAMMING IN THE 7TH INNING. HOW CAN YOU DO THAT AND EXPECT TO CALL YOURSELVES A SPORTS APP FOR FANS? This is a great app if you don't mind the games shutting off in the 4th quarter, 8th inning or 3rd period. On multiple occasions this app just shuts down because it ran out of time and in the most important part of games. And the price of $54 per month, you might as well get cable and you will be looking for other options if you are a sports fan after missing the 4th quarter, 2nd half, 3rd period or 9 inning one too many times.

This is the slowest and most difficult app of the roughly 50 downloaded on my Amazon Fire stick. It also did not offer all of the NFL games I was hoping to watch. I cancelled this option after my trial period because I could not believe how few shows it offered. I kept thinking there was something I had missed. It turned out the only thing I was missing was the shows I wanted to watch.

Horrible streaming.  Feed kept losing sound, then freezing, then going to a white screen before sending you back to the fubo home screen.  You have to reset the channel every 5-7 mins.I have fast and reliable internet service and no issues with the fire stick.Customer service only offered a partial refund $20/60.00 USD monthly advanced fee  (which could take up to 2 weeks to come back to me) and to close the account.  They said it could take up to 24 hours for a supervisor to call me back.  Unacceptable.Not worth the money.

I subscribed for cycling events only. I canceled after the 6 weeks were up due to the expense. Somewhere around $30/month. Customer service is very good. They are out of NYC and pick up the phone all day. Pretty easy to get someone.  Each person pretty knowledgeable about the service. Sometimes the missed events didn't show up after the event and I had to call. Its the same transmission as the NBC sports broadcasters. I am assuming thats why the high expense.

I canceled cable and I'm using other platforms for entertainment. I have Netflix, Prime Video, and FuboTV. I had continuous buffering issue with Hulu and I'm running 100mbps/100mbps. Nothing else that I've tried had buffering issues. The only reason I got FuboTV was for football. It lacks many of the command features which cable has but other than that it's okay.

Pros of Fubo:1. 4K Channels / On-Demand Content2. Amazing Stream Quality3. Good variety of Sports Channels4. Easy to useCons of Fubo:1. No Disney Channels in any packages (Deal-breaker for my family)2.  Limited screens that can be watch content at a time3. Customer service is lacking4. Local channels are lacking

Headings: Good choice of channels but recording forward and back needs improvement
Base_Reviews: Fubo is almost the only choice if you want to include NFL Network in your channel lineup. But the DVR controls for forward and back don't show a screenshot of where you are in the program so it's pretty useless. Other live TV apps have a better interface. We also had some stalling and slow start up with this app. We are going with a competitor even though they have less channels.

Headings: Many good channels offered, BUT no ABC and ESPN
Base_Reviews: I liked the channel offerings in general;  however, ABC and all ESPN channels are not offered.  I was willing to live without ESPN, but not having ABC was a definite showstopper for me.I liked the functionality from Amazon Fire stick and Roku where you can move around the live TV grid "By Date" for approx. one week into the future.Very nice that you can go back in time and watch previously aired content for up to 72 hours after the program's original air time.

Headings: FUBO sucks!  I was not able to watch even one show.
Base_Reviews: FUBO sucks!!!  I was not even allowed a free trial.  FUBO demanded that I give out one of my Credit Card numbers over the Internet or over the telephone to a total stranger.  I refused.  I was then denied access to watching any show on FUBO.  The "Free 7 Day Trial" is a total sham.  I even called Amazon's Customer Service to have them help me to subscribe to FUBO without the necessity of giving FUBO my Credit Card number.  Even with Amazon Prime's Customer Service representative's phone call to FUBO, they were insistent on getting my Credit Card.  I do NOT trust them.  What they could have done is to have given me a Free 7 day trial and after that week they could have billed me on my Amazon Prime bill.  FUBO has lost me as a customer forever!!!  Again,  I DO NOT TRUST FUBO!!!

Headings: Avoid this, wait until work out the bugs. Terrible performance.
Base_Reviews: Awful feed, choppy and freezes constantly. Sling doesn't do this on the same internet connection, Direct TV doesn't do this either. Also, the DVR just doesn't work. I couldn't watch a single match.

Headings: ... free trial & while it seems to be a great service w/ a variety of channels it just would ...
Base_Reviews: I signed up for the free trial & while it seems to be a great service w/ a variety of channels it just would not work on our Fire Stick or any of our Amazon devices. (only worked on my computer?). I went back & forth w/ the customer service reps for over two days but nothing worked. I will note that the customer service reps. were courteous & seemed to go out of there way to try to help but nothing worked. I do have a friend w/ a Rokku stick & it works fine for him. Was easy to cancel but I will keep watch of my bank account just in case.

I tried fubo and it was fine, but I decided to go with another streaming service. Fubo was supposed to send me an email before my trial ended, but never did. I wound up paying a month before I could cancel. It wouldnÃ¢â¬â¢t let me login to my account to cancel, so I had to call the service number after doing a search on the internet. You never talk to a human, but you can cancel by following the steps of the voice response system. Not a friendly streaming service for sure, account wise!

Headings: Great picture. Stable. Live local TV and NFL red zone but no CNN?!?!
Base_Reviews: I got Fubo specifically for NFL red zone and local live TV. Those were my must-haves. The interface and picture quality is good and the channel selection is OK, except no CNN!?!? Not happy about that. Very happy with the stability and picture quality, though. ItÃ¢â¬â¢s at least equal to Verizon fios cable TV. Might be better.

What I like about fubotv.1. Price  2. Channel selection.3. Video quality. 4. Good add ons.5. No contract, stop service whenever you want.What I don't like.1. Every once in a while fubo will freeze or stop working.2. I wish the channels had numbers and could be used to change the channel.

Headings: Pretty Good Alternative to Cable/Satellite TV Offerings
Base_Reviews: Likes:500 hour cloud-DVRGuide provides snapshot of current/upcoming broadcasts (shows, movies, etc...)Easy setupWide variety of channels (The ones that most people would watch)Dislikes:No 30 second skip-forward (Found in other providers' DVR options)No 10 second skip-backward (Found in other providers' DVR options)No configurable setting to limit number of recorded show (e.g. Only keep last 5)Fast-Forward/Fast-Backward with Amazon Fire remote is clunky and inconsistentNo 4k recordingNetwork channel ABC missing from channel offering.  Not a huge deal since ABC offers subpar programming anyhow :)

Headings: Very disappointed, falsely advertised getting my local channels
Base_Reviews: I was very disappointed. I tried several times to get questions answered from their customer service before trying it, and the answered some question but not the ones I asked. After signing up, none of my local channels were available. Lots of sports channels, but none that had the Super Bowl or any NFL for that matter. Also no NHL. Overpriced for what you get in my opinion.  I'll still with Sling Orange.

FUBU tv is just ok, it's very ambitious which is good, but it's layout is lacking a well thought out navigation.  Leaving you to search for specifics to watch. It replays commercials over and over, so annoying. The price really sets this as out of usable for less money I would choose Hulu live or YouTube TV.

It's not worth the money. More to watch on Netflix, Starz, Hulu, Amazon and commercial free or any single streaming platform than the pap smear offered on Cable TV and the alphabet networks! +you can get your news from a variety of sources on youtube (even though it's heavily censored against conservatives).

Interface is great. easy to use but im having some buffering issues. i dont have this type of problem with other steaming services like netflix, hulu, etc but i guess maybe the difference is this is live TV? it was terrible while watching the superbowl. my kids are getting frustrated also while watching their shows Nick jr, etc. likely going to cancel.

If you're a sports fan then fubotv might be the streaming service for...You get Sports Plus your lineup of cable channels.fubotv does not provide ESPN services or NFL Redzone but it does provide NFL Network... One of fubotv's best features is their menu, especially if you're a soccer fan, great navigation features to follow your favorite teams and their games... But it comes with a price, fubotv is a little more pricey than most streaming services.($60-$65/mo. I also like to add that fubotv has great NBA,MLB,NHL,NFL, coverage as well. you will have to look up there packages to see if they carry your favorite cable channels.

Headings: Not bad, just not for me
Base_Reviews: The service is too expensive to be considered a cord cutting alternative. I realize it has tons of sports which are not cheap but I still don't think it's a good cord cutting option. The video quality is sub-par in my opinion. Despite having a very fast internet connection, the video seemed to buffer everytime I opened an event. Additionally, the video seemed to lag and get choppy during the fast moving times of sports games or TV. Overall the service is not bad, just not what I was looking for.

All the channels I watch and none of the useless extras. Recording feature works great. Would like it if the fast forward actually scrolled on a timeline and you could see the video moving forward in real time. Right now your forward clicks move the show forward blindly in increments of 15 seconds.

Headings: Freezes a lot.  Have to log in a lot
Base_Reviews: I like the channels that fubo offers, All my favorites.  The picture is clear when it gets focused.  Sometime looks pixilated for a minute or two.  I have to log back into fubo quite often. My picture will freeze, then I get the circle.  I have to exit out and come back in.  I do have a lot of devices running in my house, but my living room TV that has fubo is the only device that freezes.  Not the video gamer, not the fire stick TV in a bedroom, or the 2-3 iPads that are in use and 4 phones with no drops or freezes at all.  I have 200 mgb download speed and two routers.

Paying $44 a month for fubo is ridiculous. It plays the selected channel for about 1 minute before it loses signal and I have to exit out to the main screen and reload the selected channel. I shouldnÃ¢â¬â¢t have to do that with amount of money IÃ¢â¬â¢m paying. It makes no sense that when it loses signal, it will not regain it again unless I reload the channel. I know itÃ¢â¬â¢s not my internet because I donÃ¢â¬â¢t have problems with any other devices. Very unhappy.

I enjoyed this service, but in less than a year, they're raising the price $10/month for channels that don't interest me. I am ending my subscription this month as the price is more than my DirecTV used to charge me. Very disappointed and unable to get any response over the phone or via email to customer service. If you sign up now, your cost will increase in August by $10.

Headings: Not bad but, definitely needs some improvement.
Base_Reviews: So far this app has worked fairly well for me, had some buffering issues at the beginning but that was due to my slow internet service which eventually was fixed, the price is really fair for what is provided, I was paying before over $120,00 a month and I didn't have any sport channels other than just ESPN, that's why I dropped Direct TV. The only thing negative I can say for now is the "Subtitles and Captioning" that had recently been popping up on some channels, not sure thou if it is the TV networks but, that is annoying if you're watching a game, don't really have any options of function controls, so far I've having been able to figure out how to  get rid off the subtitled, in addition to it I also wish fubo TV will add on more sport channels, out of the 11 channels provided, 5 are about movies that no one cares about, I hope that fubo TV will improve it's service for more customers's satisfaction.

This is a great streaming service with most channels available except a few like TVOne and others. I am considering this service to replace my DirecTV Now/AT&T TV. The interface could be a little better and I wish it would continue to play the current channel while I browse the guide.If they fix that and offer a discount with Showtime, I'm sold.

I would have given zero stars if that was an option. Everything was in Spanish and I couldn't figure out how to switch it to English. I called the customer service number (which is automated) and it said it couldn't find my account. I cancelled it within 30 minutes of starting. Save yourself the headache. Don't waste your time. There are plenty of other options that work.

What surprise me was the lack of staying connected. It couldn't have been my wifi because the other streaming apps did not lag or would time out like Fubo app did.  Twice I had to completely restart the Fubo app in order to get it going again.  Not happy whatsoever..

Headings: I like this quite a bit
Base_Reviews: I like this quite a bit. Has every channel that I am really interested in. Of course I will  add HBO and SHO. But this is what I was looking for. Docked one star for interface, UI is amateurishI ended up dropping the subscription. Buffers way to much and there is no way to setup recordings in advanced. Dropped to 2 stars

Pretty much all the channels I want but for a sports streaming service, you are missing  a totally sports channel.You don't provide ESPN. Although I can do without most of their on air talent(less), I will miss their coverage of Monday Night Football and Saturday morning College Football coverage. I will need to subscribe to Sling TV in order to get ESPN and use my antenna for the ABC Network which Fubo doesn't have either. I will continue to try to find a streaming network that carries all that. Other than that, Fubo seems to be ok so far..

Headings: Its good if you want bein and univision deportes
Base_Reviews: The basic plan has only two valuable channels...bein sports and univision deportes...the other channels included arent really of any importance.. nothing to watch there and if you want more channels you have to pay more i think 9.99 is already more than enough for at least 4 important sport channels a month but its good if you want to watch the most important soccer leagues in Europe...for me its the spanish league in bein sports...never buffers or lags it streams with a very clear picture if your internet is fast enough....

Headings: Got it for the World Cup
Base_Reviews: Overall a good app for sports although while watching TV series, the feature to move to the next episode is missing (i.e. the binge watcher feature ;-) but a great way to get World Cup Soccer from all the sources. It is even better than the Fox Sports app and it is getting many of its content from them! go figure.I was happy to get Mr. Robot season 3 ahead of the Prime videos but I have not browsed thru their contents to see the depth and breadth of the available media. The interface is somewhat confusing compared to the other major streaming content providers such as Netflix and Amazon Prime videos.

Headings: Very nice but too expensive for me
Base_Reviews: Great selection of tv shows & movies. I was happy to find an app I could finally watch Dr. Phil on but disappointed I canÃ¢â¬â¢t afford to buy it. Love the DVR feature. Just wish you could pick which channels you want & only pay for those

I signed up for a free trial. Did not like how the sporting events lagged. It has taken me 3 days and contacting customer service and I still have not been able to cancel.  They make it impossible to do so. Be sure it is what you want, or youÃ¢â¬â¢ll have a headache trying to get out of it.

Tried watching sports, hgtv and a movie. In each case, one of two things would happen every 5-10 minutes1. video freezes while audio continues, then video "jumps" to the current location of the audio. You miss several seconds of video2. video and audio repeat the last several seconds of what you watched. So, as you're watching a show, suddenly you're rewatching the last 5 seconds or so. It happens quite oftenNB: have a dedicated 60 mpbs internet line; watching via FireTV Stick, located about 3 feet from the router. No other devices consuming wifi or internet at the time.I've since read that this is an issue with FuboTV. I don't experience these problems with Netflix, Prime video, Hulu, Youtube or when casting from a mobile deviceThat being said, the interface is horrible. I preferred my MediaOne (or whatever it was in those days) cable interface in the 90's to this. No search capability at all. Can't continue to watch a show while scrolling for another. No last channel or favorites concepts. So, in 2 days, prior to the end of the trial, I'll switch to Sling and compare.

Headings: Would be nice, if it did anything.
Base_Reviews: Nothing worked. None of the links. The connection would time out trying to connect, in WiFi and without. When it finally loaded and I clicked on any of the channels, they said the link was broken. Definitely not worth $30 a month.

Headings: Cancelled trial subscription after a few hours
Base_Reviews: Although the price and offering sounded good at first, there were several show stoppers. There is no ABC service currently. I missed that when reviewing available channels. The web interface for fubo.tv would cause my browser to freeze. The additional charge for DVR services seemed excessive. I cancelled the trial subscription before I had a chance to give that a try.

I'm happy with the number of channels we get , very compatible with cable ( we ordered extra channels). Get all the channels we love and the picture is clear. My only issue is that occasionally the sound will be behind the picture along with the live sound so you get a echo like effect, then if you change the channel that previous channel sound stays on. I found that if you restart the fire stick it re-sets and fixes the issue. Overall very happy with Fubotv

Headings: Did not like the user interface
Base_Reviews: Very annoying to watch part of a movie and then to come back later and not have that movie resume at the point you stopped.  Happened more than one and the forward feature was "unavailable".  Not my cup of tea.

The lack of major sports channels, and an interface that needs improvement are the main reasons I decided not to continue with FuboTV.  For example, when you navigate back to the Guide, you lose the present channel's sound and picture.

Layout is a little odd/confusing. I wish it would open to the guide right away, instead of its own homescreen. Only NFL channel missing for us is ESPN, which I would love the option for, even if it was extra. Otherwise, there's a pretty decent mix of local channels and others, such as Cheddar.

Headings: DON'T DO 7 DAY TRIAL VERY CONFUSING
Base_Reviews: DON'T DO 7 DAY TRIAL VERY CONFUSING doesn't Bring you to parts of the app where you cant get out of the trail until it shows up on your bank statement $64.00/monthly. And is somehow ties to ESPN. Even called tech support they had no answers??? Hours on the phone-still not resolved. More hours on the phone today. Major point; There is NO one place you can find everything you can find about ALL of your apps on Amazon five TV. SO if you get charged first get the bank transaction number. Then call Amazon and they say they will take it off.

Headings: YouÃ¢â¬â¢re not providing a better product than Cable
Base_Reviews: DonÃ¢â¬â¢t say Ã¢â¬ÅWatch FreeÃ¢â¬ï¿½ and then charge $60 for a Ã¢â¬ÅFreeÃ¢â¬ï¿½ItÃ¢â¬â¢s false advertising!You are just as bad as Cable.The whole point of Ã¢â¬ÅstreamingÃ¢â¬ï¿½ is to watch WITHOUT paying the insane fees Cable companies charge, and get a better quality picture.If a consumer is paying $65+ for hi speed internet in order to stream and youÃ¢â¬â¢re charging $60 on top of that, why wouldnÃ¢â¬â¢t I just go with a Cable company?I think that your corporate bigwigs are completely missing the point of providing better product for the consumer.

I signed up for a 7 day free trial the day of the Super Bowl for the halftime show and forgot to cancel until the day it renewed (8 days later), because the messages were going to junk mail. I called the same day I was charged and it was "renewed" for $59.99 for the coming month. NO REFUND, NI MERCY - RIDICULOUS AND BAD CUSTOMER SERVICE

Headings: Great option to cutting the cable
Base_Reviews: It has most of the channels I watched on satellite for almost half the price. Simple remote with my device makes it a little time consuming to navigate channels. Clear picture, no buffering. Just need a good internet provider with speed and your ready.

Headings: Endless password resets, dormant support team.
Base_Reviews: Contents is probably OK but  set up is a chore. So far I have reset my password 5 times in 5 days, still no access on my TV (thru Fire stick). Have asked for support on Friday, still waiting for an answer ........

Headings: DoesnÃ¢â¬â¢t have the features of fubo app on Apple TV, roku and PlayStation Vue
Base_Reviews: you canÃ¢â¬â¢t view the guide while watching a program. Apple TV and roku apps allow you to continue to watch a stream while surfing the guide to see what else is on. CanÃ¢â¬â¢t do that with firestick. It also doesnÃ¢â¬â¢t support side by side streams allowing you to watch more than one channel at the same time. Apple TV and and  PlayStation vue allow that. Amazon is huge. IÃ¢â¬â¢m not sure why they canÃ¢â¬â¢t get there app up to par with the competition.
It is not that easy to use as there are more steps in deleting the recordings and other functions - I was thinking of switching from Hulu to FuboTV but now I have to think over again.

Kind of a pain to use.  With the fire stick I had to go to my computer to enter a code to get the video to work. Then when I tried to activate it on another tv (with another trip to my pc to enter a code) it killed the stream on my first tv even though it says you can watch on multiple devices at once.

Internet is unavailable where I live but get great signal so everything has to run on airplay here.  This freezes up often and your recorded shows donÃ¢â¬â¢t keep playing.  You have to re-start each new episode.

DoesnÃ¢â¬â¢t have the local ABC channel, itÃ¢â¬â¢s to glitchy on the menu. IÃ¢â¬â¢m currently using YouTube TV and it has local ABC channel but missing A&E but performs better and is $5 a mo. cheaper. Will be switching and dropping Fubu TV
Never able to stream it. Am not inter stead in it. Too much trouble and Amazon Customer Service could not help or resolve the problem. I do not want to subscribe to it.

No ESPN or local ABC, Fox is a downer...missing a lot of Football. The  fact that you canÃ¢â¬â¢t fast forward  your recorded shows stinks.  Also Im experiencing a lot of buffering and dropped signal even with 100mbps internet.  Does have Scripps channels like HGTV and  Food  network plus as bunch of Soccer channels.

Headings: Try to get a free trial before you commit. Might not be worth it.  nightmare for me.
Base_Reviews: The only app/streaming service I have that constantly freezes.  Also, if you are watching a live event that runs past the scheduled broadcast time slot, you cannot exit the channel and relaunch the live feed. your only option is to launch the replay which starts from the beginning of the broadcast with NO fast forward capabilities.  The stream was freezing throughout the 3rd period of an NHL broadcast and I could not relaunch the live broadcast. I constantly missed the last minutes of NHL games.  my frustration level with this service is thru the roof. good luck with this service.

Headings: The Amazon user interface needs improvement.
Base_Reviews: I absolutely love everything except the user interface for Amazon.  Amazon users can not browse channel listing without stopping what you're watching to get to the channel guide.  The Roku user interface doesn't have this problem.  To me it will make more sense for the Amazon user interface to be better because there is a lot more Amazon users than Roku users. Headings: Good content but unreliable. Constantly retrying to view a channel is not an acceptable experience in 2016.
Base_Reviews: I was keen to test Bein Sports on fubo tv and was pretty happy with the coverage of non-football events like F1 racing and rugby. The problem I had with this app is the flakiness of the connection. We have a 75Mb broadband link (cable) which supports all the main on-demand movie channels (Amazon, Netflix, Hulu, Crackle) with no problem. Live apps like Twitch and CBS work fine, as did SlingTV (which we cancelled due to content rather than quality of experience). But fubo tv is a hit-or-miss experience where you often have to back out and retry 3-4 times before getting a reliable connection. When it finally connects, the quality is great - but the effort needed to get there is frustrating and not up to par for an online streaming service in 2016. We cancelled the subscription as a result but would be happy to try again (pun intended) in a few months.

I understand that streaming HD video is data intensive, but the video quality on fubo is disappointing.  I am using the FireTV app, and the video quality is nowhere near as good as other streaming TV.  I give fubo 3 stars instead of 2 because they do offer a DVR feature.

Headings: Not good enough for the money
Base_Reviews: This app confusingly advertises channels which are not actually available unless you pay extra. For 10 bucks you get FUBO PRO that only includes 2 Univision channels. I was able to watch Copa America, but after that you only get to watch the US soccer ligue. No Europe, Brazil, Argentina or even Mexico soccer. Headings: Good content but unreliable. Constantly retrying to view a channel is not an acceptable experience in 2016.
Base_Reviews: I was keen to test Bein Sports on fubo tv and was pretty happy with the coverage of non-football events like F1 racing and rugby. The problem I had with this app is the flakiness of the connection. We have a 75Mb broadband link (cable) which supports all the main on-demand movie channels (Amazon, Netflix, Hulu, Crackle) with no problem. Live apps like Twitch and CBS work fine, as did SlingTV (which we cancelled due to content rather than quality of experience). But fubo tv is a hit-or-miss experience where you often have to back out and retry 3-4 times before getting a reliable connection. When it finally connects, the quality is great - but the effort needed to get there is frustrating and not up to par for an online streaming service in 2016. We cancelled the subscription as a result but would be happy to try again (pun intended) in a few months.

I understand that streaming HD video is data intensive, but the video quality on fubo is disappointing.  I am using the FireTV app, and the video quality is nowhere near as good as other streaming TV.  I give fubo 3 stars instead of 2 because they do offer a DVR feature.

Headings: So much better since the Jan 2017 update! Works great now, but would still like SAP audio capability.
Base_Reviews: I was using the FuboTV app on my FireTV stick, and it was working terribly...pausing often to buffer, lousy video quality, terrible user interface with non-intuitive controls and fast forward/back scrubbing that would only jump in 9 minute increments.  I was about to give up on the FuboTV service, but then they upgraded the application earlier this month (Jan 2017), and what an incredible difference it has made!  Since the upgrade, the video quality has been consistently good (both live viewing and recorded matches), and it has not had to pause to buffer video even once.  The user interface is much better now, with high-speed scrubbing when you hold down the fast forward/back button.  Good stuff!  Thank you to FuboTV for fixing this app!!!  Now I can cheer on Barca without technical distractions!  Just one remaining issue...I can't seem to turn on the SAP alternate audio...this would be helpful for the matches that are broadcast with Spanish commentary.

Headings: Good line up but otherwise very very poor. Only useful for live games
Base_Reviews: The options for streaming sports are limited, but fubo is not the answer. Although they have a good selection of options, the service overall is extremely poor.The apps are atrocious. The majority of the apps available, including for roku, the worst of them, are very poorly functional. On roku you can only watch live - no access to your DVR, prior games, or even to fast forward or go back. Plain simple live is the ONLY option.If you use chromecast or other way to use the app on a phone or tablet, it is slightly better, but as you cast to tv, the fast forward and all other commands no longer function, unless you stop casting.Then comes the worst part of it - say you recorded a game, or want to watch a game that happened a few hours ago. First, you need phone or app - again, no roku functionality (they have been on beta for over one year). Second, good luck watching it all. The app saves what they think is an average time for the game, and if it is a bit longer, you miss the end. On football and baseball, you reliably lose the end of the game more often than not as they record only 3 hours!!!!Bottomline, barely useful, and only for live games.
