Headings: PLEASE if you think you canceled read this
Base_Reviews: I won't post my entire experience however there is a detailed review on both trustpilot and the BBB.  The most important thing from my experience to be careful about:1,  Don't let them put you in a loop towards the end of your trial .  I canceled after 1 hour and still was put into that loop where you will get replies to emails where the goal may be to run out the clock on the 7 days.2.  VERY IMPORTANT - They will tell you that you have to cancel through the app, and that was easy enough to do. but thank god I didn't hit yes , i confirm I want to cancel, and look away from the screen as it went back to their home page.  A statement that really blended in with everything else and was only on for a second or two said that my cancellation was not successful.  This is where I knew it was a scam.  It should have given me an error when I hit that confirm button and not let me cancel or I should have gotten and email generated by the system stating that my cancellation was not successful and to please contact customer service.  Of course neither thing happened.  I can only imagine how many people have hit that button and looked away, went to a different tab quickly, or just didn't notice the hard to notice or because it was so fast thought it said that their cancellation was, instead was not, successful.If you are reading this before signing up with these people, unlike me, Don't!  Run and don't look back.And if you know you canceled through the app within the 7 days and still got billed, you are not crazy rather you were scammed.If you do cancel through customer service ask for a confirmation email and if you don't have one within 15 minutes call back.  I received my almost immediately.Hope this helps someone either get the money they were scammed back or prevents someone getting taken in the first place.

Headings: Pointless - The content is available elsewhere. Sometimes for free.
Base_Reviews: It seems Fubo has missed the point of the  cord-cutting "targeted streaming content service" trend. Or, at least, they want you to think it's cord cutting. Unlike NFL, NBA and MLB apps that offer the user the ability to focus on just the content they are after (baseball, hockey, US football), Fubo delivers packages of fairly low bandwidth sports streams that force you to channel surf in order to find the content you're looking for. (Let's face it, there are hundreds, if not thousands of football matches going on around the world all year long),The truth is, when you're forced to buy bundled packages that resemble what you are already paying for with traditional "cable tv", you've just exchanged one cord for another. For most people, internet and standard cabe tv use the same physical wire to the house. Using Fubo to stream the same channels means you are actually using a SLOWER (lower bandwidth & quality) stream to watch the same channels in lower quality. PLUS you are paying for the additional data/bandwidth usage that goes against your monthly allotment...- And before Fubo says "but you can watch on computer or mobile device"; most cable providers already offer mobile apps or web access to live channels. Most major networks already offer mobile/web access to streaming content if you can prove you have a traditional cable tv contract. (NBC/ABC/FOX/SKY etc..) - So (MAYBE) Fubo has missed the point on cord cutting and targeted streaming, (MAYBE) Fubo knows but wants people to think it's a cable/cord killer service, or (MAYBE) Fubo is an initiative sponsored by a major cable company to rope former customers into a service that, at it's core, is exactly what people are trying to get away from or already paying for.NOTE to Fubo: The point of targeted steaming apps is to allow customers to pay for ONLY the channels they use. HBO, Showtime, Cinemax, Mhz, MLB,, Netflix, Amazon Prime all do this very well.. So if Fubo REALLY want to impress customers, they will figure out a way to corral all of the network relationships they've made into apps or options within their app that allow customers to purchase focused content like EPL, Europa League, Bundesliga League, specific team matches or cup competitions without the need to channel surf and slog through irrelevant content to find the content they're seeking. Otherwise, there's really no point. The content is available elsewhere. Sometimes for free.

Headings: FuboTV Service is OK and may be Right for you but some Services needs to be improved.
Base_Reviews: Note:  I have not used the Amazon App for FobuTV.  This review is for FuboTV service.  I sign up for FuboTV from their website & have only used them for little over 2 weeks now.  I replaced Google TV service with FuboTV due to Google getting out of TV Service & for new customer suggest either YouTubeTV or FuboTV.  I could have kept Google TV Service but if they're not accepting new subscribers, then sooner or later they'll dumb those who have changed off or drive up the price to make you change.  On the plus side I will be saving $$$ by going to FuboTV instead of Google TV, which was part of my decision to switch now instead of when Google makes me.Is FuboTV service right for you?  Maybe I can help.  I really don't like doing review, because my general experience is only 2 type of people normally write a review.  1) Those that are extremely happy with the service & 2) Those that are dissatisfied with the service.  Me, I'm neither extremely happy or dissatisfied, which is why I'm actually doing this review.  I'm a highly Technical Network Administrator for a very large manufacturing company for over 30 years.  I'm the person in our Division of our Company that makes Technology works.  That being said, I know how I would like FuboTV to work/the way it should work.FuboTV Channel vs. it's cost.  This is a decision that each person must decide for them self.  For me, once Disney/ESPN came to FuboTV it had the channel I wanted most.  What I mean by wanted most is, it didn't have everything I wanted but if I got/changed to FuboTV service, I wouldn't be going looking for another service to get any additional stations.  (That wasn't true for any other service that I looked into like:  YouTubeTV, Sling, Philo, or AT&T.  OK, AT&T might also have the channels but didn't like the cost or DVR Service they offer & wouldn't try them because of it.)  YouTubeTV was close but still missing some channels & didn't like the ideal of losing my DVR after 9 months.  Also FuboTV really doesn't have many of mine local stations & from what I can tell unless you live in the top 5 or 10 cities in the US, it probable won't have very many or yours either.  What I did was buy an antenna for about $40 & get about 20+ local stations.What I like about FuboTV:*  Has the channels I wanted/could live with without adding another TV Service provider.*  Price for the channels I get.  (After paying for cable bills & seeing them always going up, glade to have it finally come down some.)*  DVR 30 Hours with option for 500 Hours & you can keep your recording as long as you want them.  (Most review will say that YouTubeTV has the best DRV services.  I don't agree.  I would rather have only 500 Hrs. of DVR & be able to keep shows for the length I want to keep them, then to have Unlimited Recording but lose all recordings after 9 months.  But that's me.)*  Ability to mark channels as Favorites & have them appear on top of the menu.  (You're also able to re-order your Favorites, in case you want to add one to your list & have it move to the top your menu.)*  Profiles - Each family member can have their own Profile*  Different View of the Stations you want (Standard TV Guide or by Network).*  Pause Live TV (it works my not very well)*  Max of 3 concurrent steaming (YouTubeTV allows 4)What I dislike about FuboTV: (Some will be the same as I like but will explain what I dislike about it.)*  Profiles - Yes it's nice to have them but when I replace my cable server with FuboTV service, every time I launch FuboTV, I have to select the Account Profile to use.  It needs the ability per device to set a default Profile it'll auto logon/use.  Once on that device, I can always change if I want another Profile.*  Pause Live TV - Great must have in live TV service but FuboTV Pause just doesn't work all that well.  1)  Once you un-pause & try to skip a commercials you don't have any indication when to stop the skip.  Give me a preview of what I'm skipping, so I know when the commercials are off.  (YouTubeTV give you a preview when skipping the commercials.)  2)  Rewinding Live TV doesn't work if the shows goes off.  If a new TV show has just started 10 seconds ago & you want to rewind to the end of the last show due to walking out of the room of somebody was taking to you, you can't rewind to see it again/catch what you missed, even though it's only been off 10 seconds.  Come on give user 10 to 30 minutes to rewind once a show goes off, in case we want to go back.  3)  If you like to binge-watch live TV, then due to #2 Pause reason above, your in trouble.  I like to pause live tv to 30 to 90 minutes & do something else.  Then come back & watch the station I paused & skip the commercials.  Doing this on FuboTV will cause you to miss something you wanted to see.  Once the show goes off you paused on, you're in trouble.  It will let you finish watching the show you hit pause on but if also want to watch the show that comes on after the show you paused, when I pause, ff, or look at menu, the show stops.  I have to go off the show, then back on it or go to view Live to start watching it at that point in time.  Anything that was paused is now gone.  (This has cause me to miss many things I wanted to watch.)*  Profiles Recording are only available to the Profile that recorded the show.  OK, keeping the who record show per profile separately is not necessarily bad but give me another options to view all profiles recorded show too.  So if I want to watch something my wife/child has recorded I have to log onto their profile to watch it.  Then when I'm done log back onto my profile.  The total DVR recording (either 30 Hrs or 500 Hrs) is shared across all the profiles but not the shows.*  Max of 3 concurrent steaming, needs option to have 4/match YouTubeTV, which allows 4.What I would like to see:  (This list excludes fixing what I dislike, which I think needs to be fixed.)*  Does anybody remember ever using Picture within Picture?  Why not bring it back with Internet Live TV services.  Esp. for a TV service that really boost about all the sports show they have.  Would love to spit my screen have 2 current live Football games going on it & simple selecting the left/right side would change the sound to that game.  (This may just be me but I would love to have the ability to watch 2 live TV Stations at the same time.  Yes it would be smaller on the screen but with 50, 60, 70, 80, 100+ size in screens today, don't really think that would be a big issue.  It wouldn't be for  me.)  I've seen some people mount to TV on the walls to get this function.  (One of the TV is usually smaller then  the other to get this function but this make me think I'm not alone i wanting this feature.)

Headings: 3+ Month Long  Redundant Running Commercials Spoil the FuboTV Experience
Base_Reviews: Have had FuboTV for 6mos and I have no issues other than a few hiccups on streaming occasional. What they need to fix is their commercial programming. I have contacted them about having to watch & listen to the Dr. Dre Beats headphone commercial at every commercial break since January. The song being played is very annoying and having to hear it every 5 - 10 min is noxious at best. Their tech support weiner replied back quickly but said they have no control over the commercial programming I call B.S. as I checked multiple channels and that obnoxious commercial is being run on all of them. The next new commercial just arrived from Chili's. I won't buy Beat headphones and I won't go to Chili's just because you drive your message at me every 10min.

Headings: Good content, just not for me...
Base_Reviews: After trialing FuboTV for a week I chose to cancel.  The sports content was very good (for international sports), and the content of movies and tv programs was pretty good.  My main complaints were: 1. while I could save or record movies soon to be aired on individual networks, I did not see a way to save those that were on demand, meaning that each time I wanted to watch an on demand movie I would need to do a new search through all movies.  Being able to save movies to a favorites list would have been a very good option.  2. TV programs I liked could be saved, or recorded.  There was then a list created of all of the programs I was following, which was great.  What wasnÃ¢â¬â¢t great was that the list only displayed 20 shows or recordings, which means that after I spent my time going through everything offered on Fubo and saving or recording the content I was interested in, the majority of it was saved, but not searchable as only 20 items were kept in the list.  Very frustrating! Again, good content, but the delivery of that content and the difficulty in identifying something to watch was why I cancelled.Customer service: canceling within the trial period was a challenge, but eventually the monthly charge I incurred as a result of not being able to easily cancel was fully refunded, and I thank Fubo for that.  Unfortunately, it took way too much time, effort, aggravation, and unfortunate negative reviews to make that happen.  After getting the runaround for several days I was finally contacted by a woman who took care of the problem in a matter of seconds.  Had it been a strait forward process from the beginning, and if Fubo cleans up the customer service issues I experienced it would be a very good service for a lot of people, just not for me.

Headings: be highly skeptical of positive reviews-avoid this garbage
Base_Reviews: I signed on for trial to watch ALDS baseball only to find the games i wanted to watch weren't broadcast. Tried some of the programming which was basically over-the-air with commercials that I already get for free.  When I called to offer my feed back and get a refund they were totally unresponsive.  Heres the deal: product was not worth $60/month when you can get more way content from broadcast+hulu+prime+neflix+roku for $10 less a month, all I got was a sales pitch of cognitive dissonance. Totally clueless.  Avoid at all costs.

The Fubo TV live is OK. I had several occasions where live shows (NBC) have issue with unsynchronized audio and video. I tested FUBO TV for 1.5 monts and decided that Hulu offers more for less money. After canceling my subscription (6/29) I immediately lost Fubo TV on my Roku device and LG TV. After 30min long technical support Ã¢â¬ÅhelpÃ¢â¬ï¿½ I was told that this is very well known issue between Roku and Fubo TV. This issue is not published anywhere so I could not know that 20 days of my subscription will be lost. IÃ¢â¬â¢ve asked for refund for my subscription that expires on 7/19 but Fubo TV agent told me that they do not have refund policy and that he cannot help me. So needless to say STAY AWAY from this company.

My husband and I loved Fubo. Then someone got a hold of our password and kept kicking us off while we were watching TV. Was told to change my password and that would fix it. It didn't. So we created a new account to avoid getting kicked off, and they flagged us and blocked us from signing up for a free trial. I asked if we could proceed without the free trial, as we are willing to continue paying for the service, and I was told we were blocked from signing up ever again. A little disappointed considering we loved Fubo and would love to continue paying for the service.

Headings: It feels like a part time job using this thing
Base_Reviews: Miserable. All this thing will do is raise your cortisol. I have never felt hatred for an inanimate object before. It feels like a part time job using this thing. I feel like I should get a paycheck. It had made what is supposed to be a relaxing pastime a stressful headache. It's like paying for stress. The DVR function is useless because it won't show you an image when you rewind. You will end up missing a lot of your show or doing an exhausting rewind and fast forward dance trying to figure out where you were. It's exhausting and can ruin a sports event or show. If you try to watch a live program you will get constant "Hang Tight. We're looking for your video" and "Something Went wrong" messages. Its basically not a useable product. I have tried to use it with my Iphone8, 2018 MacBook Pro and Roku device. Get cable or an Apple T.V.. I don't know. Find another way. This has really made my life worse. It's just a bundle of stress.

They offered a free 7-day trial. I wanted to watch a game so I said oh sure why not. The game was then blacked out in my area. I canceled the service literally 15 minutes after signing up. They said that 2-years early I had used the service. So, my free trial was void. They charged me a full month of service. Even though I didn't use it and the game they promised I couldn't watch. They are literally a scam. The only support you can find is online through chat. The individuals speak (type) in broken english. They won't give a refund even if you are right, it is a bait and switch. Don't sign up or you will be next!

Headings: The streaming was horrible. The picture kept pausing and skipping
Base_Reviews: The streaming was horrible. The picture kept pausing and skipping. I would record a program and then play it and it would skip a lot. Then, I would go to the network website and watch it from there and it played flawlessly. When I finally decided to end my subscription, I did so on their website, but got charged anyway. When I tried to find a number to call customer support, I looked everywhere, but did not find one. I cannot recommend this unless your are absolutely desperate to watch the Broncos on CBS. And you would have to be desperate to watch the Broncos this season.

when i clicked on the free trial offer, it took me to the next page to select my plan and enter my information. I got charged 84.39 immediately. I cancelled the trial and contacted customer service. they told me that the plan i selected was not included in the free trial. I asked why it gave me that option when i selected the free trial and they would not give me an answer. I seemed like a scam to not inform customers when selecting the free trial that all plans were not covered. Customer service just said, sorry you feel that way and refused to refund my money. Horrible business practice!

Advertised as having NFL Network and it said content wouldn't load , we wanted to set it to record a series on NFL Network and wouldn't record any of it  called two times  first person said he could see it but  would get engineers on it and call is back NO call back , called a second time she said it wasn't available we are extremely unhappy , my mom joined because dish does not have NFL right now and we are canceled due to false advertising and poor customer service!.

Headings: CRAP CRAP CRAP CRAP CRAP CRAP
Base_Reviews: CRAP CRAP CRAPCRAP CRAP CRAP!!!I would give it ZERO stars if I could.WHAT A WASTE OF MONEY FOR THE TOUR!!!Every time I try and watch replay the screen eventually freezes and starts over from the beginning of the stage. No clue as to when it will happen...but it happens everyday. The platform does not allow to fast forward or reverse. What a worthless website.NEVER AGAIN. I tried to contact them and NEVER got response. I have never been able to see an entire stage before it crashes.Do the world a favor and SHUT IT DOWN

I signed up to watch Le Tour de France  on FUBOTV. After paying $50.00 for a one month subscription, FUBO informed me that the fast forward and fast back feature normally available on any recorded content was not available. This feature is routinely available on sports streaming services and has been available on past streaming services for Le Tour. The feature is especially valuable for an event as long as a day's stage in The Tour. To allow subscribers to sign up with out informing them of the absence of this service is quite simply fraudulent. My subscription fee is non refundable. FUBO is simply streaming NBCSN for this event. I have since learned that I can subscribe to NBCSN directly for the same money and watch recorded content with the fast forward and fast back feature.I give FUBOTV one  star only because giving them no star is not an option.

Headings: The other streaming services are better.
Base_Reviews: FuboTV is a disgraceful experience.  I have tried it several times over the last year and it has only gotten worse.  Perhaps you may like it if:1) you enjoy live events streamed to you several minutes after they happen.2) you enjoy FuboTV injecting their own commercials into the stream, played at every commercial break, sometimes more than once in the same break.  When you see the same commercial 50 to 100 times over a couple of hours, your head is ready to explode.3) you like a menu where you have to press a button 20 times or more to find a channel.4) you are a cycling fan and pay extra for Fubo Cycling only to find that it doesn't have a single live event for over 3 months, and repeatedly shows an obscure race in China from last year for the entire 3 months.5) you don't mind an app that crashes repeatedly and has navigation problems that were present several versions ago, fixed, and reappear in subsequent versions.6) you don't mind recording something only to find you have to wait several hours to view it.7) you don't mind being patronized by the 'support' staff.One good thing about FuboTV, it's easy to cancel your subscription.  Stay away.  The other streaming services also have their issues, but they are nowhere near as frustrating and annoying.

Headings: If your tv/laptop are over 6 months old, don't order this!
Base_Reviews: I got fubo specifically to watch the World Series.  But after creating an account, profile, et al, I was finally able to find the game in the list of programs.  But when I click on it, the screen goes black and it gives me this message:"This Match is available in 4k.  But it looks like this device doesn't support 4k resolution.  Visit fubo.tv/4k for a list of supported devices and browsers."OK, it's *available* in 4k, but can I watch it in whatever k my tv has?  Apparently not!  And not my laptop either!  My laptop is barely a year old and my tv is maybe a couple years old, and yet their technology is not enough to show fubo's ONLY way to show the game??  It feels insulting to tell me to go to their website to see what devices it works on.  Like I'm going to buy a new TV and laptop just to be able to watch this unreliable channel!  Instead of fubo finding a way to play on my device, they tell me to find a device that will play fubo.  Ridiculous.

If you're a fan of ESPN or SKY, forget getting those.Customer support is crap.The initial answering message requires you enter 1 for English, etc, etc, then it'll give you five options of which you have to wait for all to be given before it'll take your choice.Then approximately 45 second later you end up having to do the same thing over again and this will continue, as I found out, for approx 45 minutes until an actual person picks up.

Headings: Wanted to like this, but so far the interface makes it impossible to do so
Base_Reviews: When I try to use the channel guide, it only allows me to see a couple of hours into the future to see what is on or to record any show that I may want to see.  So far I can find no way to do it, and without that functionality I see no use for this service as it applies to me.  I will be cancelling if this is not possible to do.

I accidently had two email accounts active during a free trial period. Customer service tries to sell. They could not deactivate the account. without me reopening one after I tried online. 45 minutes later, both accounts were closed. I only knew one was billed. Then next month, I got a bill for the other one. Even with my ticket number, since the account was closed for over two weeks, there was no way to reimburse my account. bottom line - no warning free trial is over. 1 minute into free trial will charge you. customer service people were kind, and compassionate, but the rules tied their hands

Headings: Awful, possibly the worst streaming service available in the US
Base_Reviews: Got this for the World Cup, 2018. Absolutely awful service.Never had any problems streaming HD, I have a 100MB cable connection, Netflix, Amazon etc. all work great.Fubo however:-Constant steaming issues, pauses, blurs, complete crapouts-Doesn't work with my privacy VPN-Commercials on all the shows and films-Stupid expensive

Headings: Beware, They are playing the difficult to cancel game
Base_Reviews: Got the "free" 1 week trial to test it out.  The streaming service was far below any sort of watchable standard with lots of pauses.  I cancelled on day 7 of the free 1 week trial and was charged anyway.  I tried to call them twice and was hung up on both times by the automated answering service with a recorded message of "we are sorry but we can't take your call at this time"...click.  I tried two different initial menu choices and ended up the same way both times.  Beware these guys...not professional so far.  I submitted a ticket on their website so if they respond well to that I will come back to this and reflect that with an increased rating.

We got FuboTv so we could watch all the football games this season. The app was cool because it had so many different channels however, sometimes the games would cut out, or not have a clear picture, maybe because whatever signal was bad or something. That issue was the least of my worries though. My issue was when I tried to cancel, After cancelling 2 days before I was supposed to be billed again...I still got the money taken out of my account. I tried calling the two customer service numbers I could find, one is always a "busy" tone and the other is automated and no matter what option you select, it hangs up on you. I tried this four times and got hung up on each time. I emailed the customer service email from two emails and still have never received a response. HORRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE.....actually, NO customer service.

Headings: Fubo stands for Financially Unstable Burglar Operation
Base_Reviews: I had Fubo for maybe 6 or 7 months. It was buggy, the stream would get choppy or freeze regularly, and I didnÃ¢â¬â¢t have ESPN. Oh well, I thought. $45 a month is still worth it. That is, until receiving an additional $26 charge for no apparent reason that they refused to refund me. That is stealing so I cancelled my subscription and itÃ¢â¬â¢s doubtful that I will ever have any business with them ever again.

Please do not suscribe to this app they can charge you up to three times for one month subscription and refund only one month. I called and tru three times to understand what happened but they  clearly have no idea how to keep customers. Also, the buffering time is long and their Ã¢â¬ËexcuseÃ¢â¬â¢ is the the device doesnÃ¢â¬â¢t support fuboTV! Iphone X and apple tv are supposed to be included on the list of devices...

Headings: Zero customer service for log in
Base_Reviews: I would leave a better review but there is problems with my log in and no customer service to fix it.  Waited 3 hours on the phone, no answer.  Waited 48 hours for tech response to a ticket, still waiting and the link to chat is gone or non existent.  Service sucks if you canÃ¢â¬â¢t get it

Worst streaming service ever. Terrible streaming and service. Don' t waste your money on this 2nd rate streaming company. The stream reception is terrible, or you won't get the channels at all. Customer service is weak. They have 1 remedy for everything. I was streaming with roku. Beware !

Constant buffering, blurry, fuzzy, low Rez disconnections, stalled shows. I have YouTube TV too and very same show at the very same time comes in great. My internet speed is super fast. Customer service is VERY responsive but no fix.

This is the worst streaming service I have ever used. I am getting charged for a subscription customer support has Ã¢â¬ÅcancelledÃ¢â¬ï¿½ several times. I also suddenly had a price increase up to $85 a month for no reason and it was after I had supposedly canceled my subscription myself. If I could give it less than 1 star I would. NEVER EVER USE FUBO AND NEVER TRY THE FREE TRIAL!!!

Headings: The worst customer service i have ever seen on hold for ...
Base_Reviews: The worst customer service i have ever seen on hold for 25 minutes only to get cut off repeatedly by the robot non-sense, the stream was poor at best do yourself best stay away from this company. Getting a real person is impossible.

The streaming is always low quality and choppy to the point of being unwatchable. I've tried using minimum quality settings, doubling my internet speed, watching recorded tv instead of live, and streaming from mobile devices, but nothing works. FuboTV is a good concept pathetically executed. Complete waste of time and money.

Headings: $200 DOWN THE DRAIN FOR SERVICE NEVER USED
Base_Reviews: DO NOT USE !!!!!!!!!!!! MY HUSBAND CALLED TO CANCEL AFTER DWNLOAD APP AND NEVER USED THE SERVICE .He was told it was cancelled. IT WAS NOT AND EVEN THOU THEY CAN SEE WE NEVER once used the app, they would not refund our money!!!!! TERRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE!!! Wish I would have listened to the other reviewers who had the same issue!

Headings: I love the idea but their customer service stinks - I ...
Base_Reviews: I love the idea but their customer service stinks - I brought up several issues that I was having with the app for over a month . I received one automated email and that was it for over 2 weeks now.  looking into Sling Tv

Headings: They only support one Android TV device, which is the most expensive. Nvidia
Base_Reviews: The app does not work on every android device. In fact they say they only support Nvidia device.  Very expensive Android TV.  Beware if you do not have a high end Android TV unit.

The first event I tried to watch after I subscribed was a disaster.  The video crashed and then I was kicked out of Fubo and couldn't log back in.  I wasn't the only customer this happened to.  I searched twitter feeds and found out this happens a lot.  Unsubscribed.
No customer service. Extremely difficult to cancel. Programming is mediocre. My experience with Fubo was a total waste. Did I mention no customer service.
Terrible.  Freezes constantly.

The worst steaming experience ever.  Terrible quality in trying to watch a live game that was being recorded simultaneously.  The recording would just speed up and slow down randomly.  Cannot fast forward more than 10 secs at a time.  Buyer beware!

I hate this service. Never use it and I am never coming back. Do yourself a favor and AVOID IT. Customer service stinks and so does the deal. Waste of money. May as well throw your $45 into the trash.
Lags, commercials, overpriced. Don't waste your time.

Headings: Horrible service. I have been unable to watch 3 ...
Base_Reviews: Horrible service. I have been unable to watch 3 events in one week because of some outage or technical error on their end. And their customer service was slow and didn't solve my problems.
Server crashes and when it comes back, the resolution prevents anything but blurs on the screen. For the price, absolutely not worth it.
Glitchy  and slow

Headings: Another Useless App That Requires a Cable Provider
Base_Reviews: What exactly is the point of a streaming app that requires a provider connection? If I already have a provider service, that probably has a DVR device, this app (and the service it provides) is completely useless. NBC Sports, please hop into the present and provide a true streaming app.No one needs cable any more so drop the provider requirement and join the new paradigm.

We are trying to watch the olympics with the app and they show the same commercials in the same order over and over and over again, and about every 5 minutes! It is to the point of cruelty and torture, really. It makes me not want to watch anymore. They even interrupt the events!!  I don't ever want to buy or support Koch, eat McDonalds, use IHC, or watch Mamma Mia ever!!  The way they are forcing the ads is definitely having a negative effect that I am sure the sponsors did not intend and are not paying for.

All the time. I can't clear the error.In the past few days, I have uninstalled the app an reinstalled it numerous times... all in some combination of rebooting my Fire TV, deactivating my account, signing out of my NBC Sports account on my laptop and Chromebook and yelling at my TV.Short of resetting the Fire TV to the factory default (not ready to go nuclear to watch the Premier League without fake sound) there is nothing I can do to correct this problem.  I've wasted hours trying to fix an issue that is not mine.I have sent this same message and photos to support@nbcsports.com.  It is NBC's responsibility to develop an app that works, and it is Amazon's responsibility to offer and distribute products that are promised to work.

Headings: Terrible app/experience; can't access live content because of technical problems with subscription authentication requirement
Base_Reviews: The app says I can get access to content if I'm a Dish Network subscriber (I am) and my Dish programming includes NBC Sports (it does). So I:1. Got an activation code through the NBC app (Android version running in Amazon Fire).2. Entered it at nbcsports.com/activate3. Received this message: "Congratulations, you've successfully activated your device and can now watch NBC Sports. It may take a moment for your device to update. You have access to NBC Sports video from the following networks: NBCSN . . . ."4. Then this message from the app: Ã¢â¬ÅYou do not have a subscription to view the requested content. To upgrade your programming go to mydish.com/programming and then log back in to view content.Ã¢â¬Support from Androidtv@nbcdigital.zendesk.com and support@nbcsports.com was useless. They said "In order to view live content in the NBC Sports app, you need to have a cable subscription that includes the USA network." My Dish Network programming does include the USA Network. So I'm not allowed to watch NBC's commercial-saturated lives sports programming because I have Dish instead of cable? That makes no sense.

Headings: Not Working on any of my Fire TV devices.
Base_Reviews: I have been using this app for over a year and about two or three weeks ago it has stopped working on any of my Fire TV devices. The app loads but all I get is a cryptic message "an error has occurred". I have tried every suggestion and nothing has worked.

It's too bad that the people at the NHL and NBC Sports have not figured out that customers are trying to use these apps because they have cut their cables. Many customers, like myself, are tired of paying large bills for unwatched stations while cable prices continue to climb. I am a huge Pittsburgh Penguins fan and wanted to watch the post season games, but the NHL and stations like NBC will only grant access to the games if customers provide their cable company information. If these stations don't catch on soon, they will get left behind, like newspapers and video rental companies The Internet has changed everything. NBC can either adapt or become irrelevant. More and more people are cutting their cable connections. If NBC wants to have customers, then it needs to grant people access to the games who don't have cable. I deleted the NBC app from all of my devices. Hopefully, Root Sports or the NHL will come through for fans. Then NBC will be a distant memory, like Block Busters.

I'd like to write a review, except the app doesn't work... at all... on multiple FireTV devices and models. both the original model and 4k 2nd generation.It simply says:ERRORAn error has occurred.Even after clearing the cache and uninstalling and reinstalling, nada. Bupkis.What really pisses me off is that a quick online search reveals that this is a common problem that has been going on for close to a year. I want my money back for my Gold subscription.

I've tried it at home, at work, at my parents house, and at friend's houses. It's not supposed to used the SSO for cable cable provider authentication, but I've tried using credentials from multiple providers anyway in case they were trying to make the switch.I've tried it on devices spanning three different generations of FireTV.It's not functional on ANYTHING. When you click open, you get the NBC logo with a spinning yellow circle for approx 1 second, then a message that says:ErrorAn error has occured.Options from that point are cancel or retry.This persists after clearing of cache and data, reinstalling the application, and even resetting the firestick to defaults.When you finally do get through to NBC support, they say they're working with Amazon to find the problem. That's the same thing they told me during the Boxing Day games, December 26th.UPDATE: This app still does not work. 7 months later the exact same error persists across all Amazon Fire TV devices.

My only issue with this app is that every time you click on an event, it makes you watch a 30 second ad. This is just a little annoying, especially when you know you are missing stuff. But otherwise, this is a great app. It offers the main sporting events that NBC has, like Sunday Night Football, hockey, etc. Additionally, it offers some unusual sports, like various tournaments (tennis, badminton, Esports, luge) as well as the Olympic and Golf channels. Lastly, it offers highlights, interview, and other short videos. Oh, and replays of full events. Just a note: a lot of unpopular sports do not have commentary or even sound equipment, so don't be thrown off when the World Billiards Tournament Game is silent. Also, you do have to have a corresponding TV subscription.

Headings: If you're getting errors read this!  Poorly deployed app, but they have the monopoly...
Base_Reviews: If you're getting an error when opening the app, or loading content, you can't have any ad blockers active.  Bypass your PIHole, remove ad blockers from computer, whatever. That fixes the problem.As for the app, it sucks. The ads are as every 1-star review describes, constant, unrelenting, and repetitive. Hockey games aren't so bad, but the Olympics were terrible.  Needing a subscription is expected, but a cable account is ridiculous. Just give a non-cable cutter friend or family a few bucks and use their account. The app is slow and sluggish. Just have to deal with that.  I would say use every means necessary to circumvent the traditional "Pay us to watch, watch our advertising, and we'll black out what we want" mentality of the networks. There are lots of options out there. The sooner everyone ditches the status quo and hits their pocketbooks, the sooner they'll revamp the pay structure to get customers back.Cancel Netflix.

Headings: ZERO stars. Awful, terrible, does not work!
Base_Reviews: I have this app on 5 Raspberry Pi's, and I also have it on 5 Amazon FireTV sticks.I *have* a cable account- so I have a valid login. Up to now it has worked fairly well on the RPi's, but as of today it is completely and utterly non-functional.It never *ever* worked on any of the Fire sticks. Never. It is authenticated with my provider, it just doesn't work.I'm not in my home state right now, so I would like to be able to watch the baseball games I am entitled to watch when I am at home. I pay for cable. It is supposed to work. I am supposed to be able to stream my Mets games anywhere in the country. Not once since I've been away from my home territory have I been able to stream a Mets game. No matter what team they are playing against, I just get an error telling me the game is blacked out in my area. Every. Single. Game.Since this app comes from the Amazon play store, I expect the damn thing to work. Why have it there otherwise? Just look at the reviews. This has got to be the most godawful piece of coding in the history of computing.FIX the damn thing or remove it. Funny how I can stream Yankees games using the Fox Sports Go app on all my devices, without a hiccup. Too bad I'm not a Yankees fan...

NBC sports and sports gold are terrible. It makes you re activate your device through your computer or phone multiple times which is a pain. You get your TV set up, then suddenly in a couple of weeks, you have to re activate.  That requires your computer and signing into NBC sports each time with a special code. And sometimes the announcer is drowned out by the road noise(cycling). The announcing staff is terrific for cycling. One other issue, I only care about one sport which I pay for(cycling) yet I have to continually pick that sport from a drop down of twenty sports even though you have to add them to your package if you want to view them. Another pain. In general I would state that NBC sports is not very consumer friendly.  If you have a problem you email someone and they send you a generic email in return that suggests they didn't read your email very carefully.

Purchased a Ã¢â¬Ësport passÃ¢â¬â¢ for a competition only screened in the US by NBC SportsGold. With no alternative way of watching my choice was either purchase the pack or not watch the games. Pricing is outrageous for what is screened for free in every other country of the world. The live stream in the six nations rugby I was watching is good (as it comes from the U.K.) but abruptly stops at half time to be replaced by strange wind like noises around the empty stadium. To watch events like the the rugby World Cup in the US you have the choice as a consumer to not watch, or pay monopoly pricing.The APP is best started 10-15 minutes prior to kick off as the security features are apt to have changed requiring swift log-ins on an actual computer (not a phone) to reauthorise what you have already paid for. This is consistent with the monopoly pricing - they donÃ¢â¬â¢t want you sharing log-in details. But it also means itÃ¢â¬â¢s tough to watch across multiple devices even when you have paid for the privilege.

No useful content even when it does work. EPL has moved to Peacuck and that is not available on FireStick. Not sure who I should be more angry with NBC or Amazon. Both are fault. NBC won't get my business any more and Amazon is about to lose it.-Previous Review- They did finally do something to fix it after 2 months . . .Worked fine for months (and still does on one FireStick). Last week, I received the same error described by many others. Tried clearing, cache, then data, then uninstalling, then resetting Firestick to factory defaults. Got it to work for a few minutes. The installed other apps, and the error returned.

Headings: The Amazon fire stick has been a good little functioning device that allows me to stream conventional ...
Base_Reviews: I purchased an Amazon fire stick and downloaded this channel APP along with many other channel app's.  I wasn't aware I would be prompted for a review from Amazon for each channel downloaded (or I wouldn't have downloaded 90% of them.)  If there are no previous words to this paragraph and a three star review, then it is obvious I haven't had the time nor inclination to review the channel APP.  I do often review items for seller discounts and therefore I am expected to leave reviews for every item purchased.  The problem here is I didn't purchase any of these channel apps, they were all free for download and use.  I will eventually get around to either reviewing each channel or deleting them from my Amazon fire stick, however when they are deleted from my fire stick the review requests remains.  Due to the fact I am rated on my ability to leave a review for all my Amazon purchases, I must leave this wordy explanation for my review explaining the fact that I wish I had not been prompted for a review on a free channel app.  The Amazon fire stick has been a good little functioning device that allows me to stream conventional shows over my home wifi and internet and although it's not the fastest device (click and wait sometimes) it does function as expected for a small HDMI stick over wifi.  I only wish there was a way to disable the requests for reviews on free channel apps.

Headings: Clunky interface and random commercial insertion during replay events BUT much better than Fox Sport Go
Base_Reviews: Clunky interface, random commercial insertion on replay events, poor search interface on replay events, and loading screens are why I will only use this NBC Sports interface if I can't hook up my laptop to the TV for some reason.Also, I really do appreciate the fact that NBC is allowing Olympic viewing on replay but the interface is not very friendly.  Please go back to the interface that was in use for the last Summer games.(EDIT) I have upgraded my rating after looking at the Fox Sports Go app which has no replay of previous events.  Looks like illegal straming from a dodgy website will be in order for the World Cup this year.  Awesome job Fox (sarcasm) to make this app look like 4 stars instead of 2.

I installed the app, signed onto my service provider and everything was working great.The next time I tried to login, i just get the "Error An error has occurred" message and can't do anything.  I did everything that was recommended,  resetting the Fire TV Cube, clearing the data/cache, and fore stopping the App.Seems to be a consistent problem and the only known solution online is to do a hard reset on the device.  That is terrible.  Works fine on Playstation and Apple TV....

I've tried over and over to view live sports broadcasts using this app on my Amazon Fire, but never been able to.  I receive their confirmation that my subscription is approved after activating the account and confirming my provider connection (Sling TV), but then wait forever for the screen to update as promised.  It never happens.  I've contacted them for assistance and spent countless fruitless minutes following their suggestions to complete the connection, but it never helps.  Even though I've received subscription confirmation numerous times, each attempt to view a live broadcast is rejected with the notice that I need to upgrade my subscription.  No information is given how to do that, and their technical support folks don't offer any such advice.

Headings: It was easy to set up with my digital projector and FireTV stick but the app has some problems!
Base_Reviews: I loaded this app onto my Amazon FireTV stick and I am watching Sunday night  NFL football live on a 11 ÃÂ½ foot diagonal screen. The video and sound quality are excellent. Unfortunately when commercials are playing, sometimes NBC blanks the screen with a spinning wheel. The football game does not start playing again when the commercials are over. It forces me to back out of the game and start it again and then the picture is perfect. Doing this though is frustrating. When I opened the app I was asked to log into the provided address and activate the streaming service by entering my device type, the access code shown on the screen and my cable TV provider. I use ATT U-verse as my cable network. I was instantly connected with the message that my service had been activated and I the game that was coming on which was the Sunday Night NFL football game.  Two weeks later is asked me to register with my cable provider again. Why?I am now watching the NFL game between the Seattle Seahawks and the Carolina Panthers. This is a good  app but it has some performance issues. How can the game broadcast be perfect HD quality but NBC doesn't want to show the commercials and it messes up the broadcast.  If this issue was fixed the app would be a 5 star app but as it is I rated it 3 stars. I can watch the game but I have to survive the commercial streaming issues

This NBC Sports app flat out does not work.  I have two firesticks and am holding onto a basic cable account just to use apps like this, and it has not worked for months!  You login, the screen never updates, you try every combination you can think of but you always end up getting this 'An error has occurred' message.  It 100% does not work, and neither Amazon nor NBC have any response or seem to care at all.  I am shocked at such a major network/product has this little effort or care for what would be a highly used app.  FYI, for golf events I've found ways to use the Internet browser and manually go to the video stream URL, which sometimes works, sometimes not.  Ended up buying a Roku just to avoid this frustration.

NBC could not care less about their streaming app or the people who pay to watch it's content. Words cannot describe my hatred of NBC Sports and this application but I will try, for the people. First off, it is so full of bugs and glitches that it makes for a truly frustrating watching experience. There is no escape, however, as they have you by the balls owning the exclusive rights to some of the best sporting available.  You will have to sign in and verify your credentials to the app so many times, I have nbcsports.com/activate as one of my most visited websites. Once you've gained access to the content you willing pay for it gets even better. There is nothing quite like waking up at 7am eastern standard time to watch some Premier League football only to have the app tell you it is unable to play this asset over and over again. If you are watching a sport that a decent amount of commercial breaks be prepared to have quick cuts to those commercials, so quick in fact that parts of the game will be cut off.  Also be prepared to see the exact same commercials for an entire year/season. You will be reciting the Liberty Mutual ads by heart in no time. Games will lag so far behind normal game time that you have to actively avoid your phone to not see spoilers. To be clear this not an internet speed issue as I pay for decent download/upload speeds. If you love sports you will find this app as a necessary evil, but it will suck out as much of your soul as possible and then charge you the NBC Gold price doing so.

Headings: Spoiler headings should be eliminated altogether like "Zlatan puts United ahead
Base_Reviews: Needs work. You can't fast forward or rewind streams using. When you try to fast forward, the app isn't recognizing the the button pressess on the remote. The app just starts blinking. Often it doesn't recognize the remote control at all. I use mostly for EPL replays, one, the location of highlights means you have to avert your eyes for spoilers. The titles are often spoilers. Replays should be a the top. Spoiler headings should be eliminated altogether like "Zlatan puts United ahead." Just title it "X v. Y highlights"  The exact same thing plagued the app during the olympics. Not that i care about olympics as this is about the app when it isn't Olympic mode. Sometimes a soccer game will resume where you left off sometimes it doesn't. There is no discernible pattern.A huge problem is often EPL soccer matches are not added to the app in a timely fashion. The game can end and it can be a day or two before it's available. Forcing you to illegal means to get the game shortly after it ends. Worse you can often log on on the phone and see that the game is actually listed for streaming.Note: I have the app on Roku too and it has the exact same issue as the layout is almost identical.Understand this:1. The app is requires you have a cable subscription. It is NOT a substitute cable service. It's not free.2. This is for the NBC Sports Channel (a cable teir sports channel) NOT broadcast NBC channel (the basic channel)

Headings: Terrible functionality. I would rather watch a less than legal stream
Base_Reviews: This app is terrible. I cannot find any way to turn on closed captioning. The playback controls are basically worthless. While watching the NHL West Final, I paused the game and intended to fast forward during the commercial break to catch up. Turns out it is impossible to rewind or fast forward. Ended up missing two goals when we went back to the live game.

Where do I start with a review of the NBC Sports app? It works, so that's a plus. There are many other apps out there for sports, but not any others which play NBC Sports, such as the Olympics. Other apps allow one to organize the offerings based on the league and date. There is no such organization with this one. Instead, you get a scrolling list of live events, a list of replayed events, and highlights. And NBC, which advertised that you can watch the Olympics anywhere and anytime, didn't bring this functionality to the Fire TV Stick. Not impressed.

NBC sports runs terribly during live events. They require you to have a paid subscription to watch half the events you follow under one sport wether you are linked to your cable provider or not. During live events the streaming tends to jitter and jump or just all out crash so you have to restart the app and go back to what you were watching. NBC butchered the streaming of Supercross, race times are always varying, sometimes you can watch the qualifiers and some races you canÃ¢â¬â¢t, some races you have to have the paid subscription to watch live and some you donÃ¢â¬â¢t. ItÃ¢â¬â¢s ridiculous. Thank you for ruining the one and only sporting even I follow each year.

Headings: Olympics on Fire TV Stick. Yes with this specific App. Here is how.
Base_Reviews: This works for Olympics on Fire TV Stick without a cable provider but watch the glitch. Each time the app reopens it toggles in the top left between the logo for this app, and the logo for the standard app which needs a cable account. Pay attention, ignore the other logo. I will add a pic if it goes through with this review.When you are in this app on this device there will be a row with hundreds of live or upcoming events. When the network is showing Olympics on NBC broadcast TV, a box for this will be in the mix of events. That mirrors the NBC broadcast, and will end as the network does. Look at the pic I will try to attach.The majority of the events are raw with no announcers or scoring, but is excellent quality, and some of the practices are shown as well.A similar App on Roku misbehaved badly for me.

Absolutely a waste of time.  No search feature available to find events, backing to arrow through  is ridiculous. Beyond that, all you have is NBCs "highlights"  edit and worthless commentary; with more commercial length than actual event coverage.  I long for the days when ABC was the leader in sports coverage. Live events, factual and to the point auditories, and no political or broadcast politics. It has 1 star because I cannot rate it lower. In diving it would rate a failed dive.

Imagine a world where you can watch the Olympics on your favorite streaming device. Like, I dunno, your Amazon Fire Stick. Well, after downloading the NPC Sports app to do just that, I am still left imagining. I configured it with my cable subscription credentials to authorize my access to the rich pagentry of the Olympic games (and why this step is necessary when I get my internet access through my cable service is beyond me, but I digress...). Anyway, after launching the app, I was able to watch every trailer, athlete interview, promo, and sports advertisement related to the Olympics -- just not the actual Olympic games themselves. No curling in this house. No downhill skiing with this app. Not one moment of the heart-pounding thrill I expected from cross-country flaming luge skating that had so captured my hopes this year. If you're into watching droll (read: not at all droll) NBC talking heads drone on about sports cliches, this is the app for you. But don't expect to watch an actual sports with it.

Tried using the app twice this month.  Used to work perfect,  apparently since the update keeps on saying there is an issue about 2 mins into a call, or goes to a white/black screen and freezes... Hopefully there is a fix soon.

Profile_Name: fun game, obsessed with it. XD lol
Base_Reviews: I got the new update and boy was I disappointed, it's extremely glitchy and does not function properly at all. It will notify me of a new message hours or days late, and you can't send/ receive pictures anymore. The new update is awful. Before the update it worked great, so if possible do not update your Skype.

Whether or not it actually works varies from update to update. There are virtually zero adjustable call settings. It's hard to believe an app specially built for a single device can be so awful even YEARS after it was released. Skype for my junky phone works better than this.

Skype keeps crashing on my kindle and it's super annoying. I use my tablet to participate in meetings and talk with my family and it has been horrible since this latest update. I have to turn off and on the tablet repeatedly to reboot skype. Please fix this glitch or we'll be moving to an alternate application.
Since the last update on Kindle, Skype will constantly freeze video calls, drop calls, crash, and distort video, It desperately needs to be fixed by developers.

I got this app to be able to talk to friends, however after signing into my account, each time I wished to call someone it would freeze, or the app would force close. This is still a problem no matter what I do, therefore I do not recommend it.

Notifications stopped comming through. Notifications still come through on other devices. Reinstalled and now it won't let me make any calls. Just keeps saying there was a problem making the call and to try again later. Also makes me sign in every single time. I tried enabling every permission and letting it use unrestricted data. Still doesn't work.
This is ridiculously buggy. It logs in whenever it wants to, crashes the entire operating system when attempting voice calls, and exhibits other issues. Would be a good app, otherwise.

I do not use this program anymore because there is a problem with the Volume control -- I contacted customer service about this and they worked me through this, but with every new update -- the problem comes back -- low volume and no way to adjust this on the Kindle Fire!

I recently received the Kindle Fire HDX 7" as a gift so I can travel and be able to Skype with it rather than having to use my laptop. I was very disappointed when I tried to skype with it and the audio was just horrible. I was getting a lot of background feedback and so was the other person. I tried to lower my volume but that only made it where I can't hear the other person on the line. We tried with laptop and Skype worked fine. I even had the other person use another device to check if the issue was was the Kindle Fire HDX 7" and it was. I think it has to do with the microphone volume settings on the kindle. Skype and Kindle, please fix this issue.
For some reason Amazon doesn't have the update but I really need to update Skype because it ALWAYS CRASHES
This app is horrible for calling. Everytime I would try it would force close and freeze. The messaging is actually good and it's easy to navigate.

At first it worked fine I was like "Pfft it works fine compared to what people said online the reviews" but when I try to skype with cousin luke it crashes. Texting works fine. Kindle FIR HD SUCKS IT DOESN'T have amazon play!!!

The program works, but that is the best I can say about it. Aside from basic tasks, the program does not seem optimized for the Kindle. For example, I gave up after four tries to reset my password. The keypad covers most of the screen and it is too easy to make mistakes. I will keep the app but make admin changes on a different device.

whenever I try to call my friend, it crashes! everytime it tell me to sign in, I have to go through this long process of fixing my password! at first it worked totally fine, and then it all of a sudden, it stops!

Not only is the other complaints true. It is a pain to download. It takes up SO much space on your device, it's not even funny. I hate it. But I have no other way to contact some of my friends. I really wish they could fix this piece of epic profanity.

Great idea, seems to work on my computer... But doesn't work at all on my Kindle Fire HD. Only good to attempt out-bound calls, only stays loaded for a few hours at most before crashing, barely dependable as anything more than an empty claim.It's clearly  a  conspiracy by Microsoft--introduce an app on another operating system (not Microsoft) and use it as a platform to say that Android is unstable--there Are lots of applications that stay loaded dependably,  you just don't know what you're doing

Headings: It's a dud... Come on Skype

The volume when connected is absurdly low, and the other party complains about the picture flipping. I have never had an issue with the ios version of Skype, and this version has so many bugs it feels like it was done on purpose to send us running to Apple.
it will not work and crush when you make a call to another device we need a new skype for HDX from "AMAZON"

Headings: Read the permission list before you download!!!

Basically with this app whenever you have a Wi-Fi signal or connection with your service provider, you're giving this company and anyone able to exploit it access to all of your personal information and all of devices functions without you being aware.

Don't do it. Just....just don't. Save your time...back out of this and don't do it..don't even consider it...Amazon...fix your ish. :| it crashes the volume is ridiculous and once you delete it it won't let you reinstall (at least for me) skypes update ruined Skype.

Ever since the update, I have had to constantly redownload because notifications work about 5 times and then never work again unless I redownload the app. I deleted 4 GB of data to keep this app and Terraria from crashing (both update problems). Fix it please.

Headings: Not a working app.  Will not allow area code to be entered
Base_Reviews: I am really peeved that the Skype download for Kindle Fire HD 8.9 does not allow for you to add the area/local code, so that you can obtain a number for your device on the local network.  This renders video chatting with other friends on Skype useless, since they have no contact number with which to reach you.  I tried to delete it twice and reload the application, and even tried the android application.  Nothing I did corrected the problem.  If you don't put the area code in and just have the state, like Texas, it gives you a phone area code for San Antonio, which is 5 hours away.  Someone needs to seriously look at this and make a correction to the app., or give us a way to fix it.  Skype is one of the main video chatting apps that most people use.  Had I known it was useless I would have spent my money on the Ipad, but i figured all i needed was to video chat and didn't need to have a camera on the back for vidoes and pictures that the Ipad includes.  At least Ipad can use SKYPE!  I'd give this app a zero if it allowed....

Freaking lag all the time and it cut off my video calls and I can't seem to call them back. So i have to shut it down and reopen but just to find out that it freaking bug again. I thought you guys were supposed to be the official trustworthy brand or something. You guys let me down.

Headings: Some things to note about the latest Skype version
Base_Reviews: I have had a 32GB 8.9 HD kindle since it first came out in late 2012 & some earlier models. If you read through many of the reviews you should notice that most of the 5 star ones were written shortly after the release of the HD series in late 2012 & early 2013. On the other hand, the poor 1 & 2 star reviews were written since late 2013 & later.I would agree with this as it matches my own experience. The original Skype for the Kindle Fire HD series worked very well but an update issued sometime late last year changed all of this. There appears to be two main issues:1. SOUND VOLUME:Even if your volume is set all of the way up before launching Skype, conversations are barely audible. This may be because MS/Skype expect you to use ear buds which is a common way to use the app. If you in fact do this then you will find the audio level to be okay. HOWEVER, if you don't use ear buds then check the volume setting within Skype using the hardware volume switch and you will probably notice that the volume is way down around 25%. If you raise the volume to 100% using the hardware volume control then conversations can be heard okay just like the earlier version and it stays this way in subsequent sessions. They may have made the initial setting this way to prevent ear bud users from blowing out their ears.2. CRASHES:I don't know what to say about this except to confirm that I have had the same experience. Skype starts okay but invariably crashes (frozen screen, no sound, etc.) within 5 minutes and will then the Kindle will spontaneously reboot. This makes what is otherwise an excellent app next to useless.So, this problem has been around for over 6 months without being fixed. Amazon gets a failing grade from me on this issue as they should at least make the original version available for download from their app store for folks having this problem while they are sorting out the issues with the latest version.

I got this app for my daughters kindle so that she could message her dad, her cousin, and me. Some random person texted my child! And I could not access the messages from the TextMe website.I wish that only people her in contacts can contact her but not sure that's possible. I don't feel this app is safe for children.I also feel that the app isn't user friendly. There are some issues with functionality and ease in adding/naming/deleting contacts.UPDATED March 2017: while our account was still active, TextMe issued OUR phone number to another person (I'm assuming a child). My husband and I have iPhones. When our daughter first received her TextMe number we input them into our Contacts and texted her several times over the course of a few months.Well this morning my husband texted our daughter to get up and get dressed but someone else responded: "I don't know you! You're not my dad!" At first my husband thought our daughter was joking around. It led to a series of texts. Our daughter denied getting or sending any texts. She showed us her app, we tried texting her, and nothing showed up. Instead someone else replied.I apologized to the other person and told them to notify their parents about this. His or her last text to me was them telling me that they were SCARED and to stop texting them.They should be scared! This is BAD! I immediately deleted my daughter's profile (which was still active) and uninstalled the app. This is not safe.
You had to give it info I was not wishing to give and I felt it would be a security risk to run this app.

Headings: The 6 month update, tldr = not free, more like "Bugmeware!!!"
Base_Reviews: All the things I said before are true. The app works, the price for the "No Add's" version is high, to high unless you are using a fire tablet as a primary texting device. The App gets more of a "PIA" the longer you use it. Dire warnings that unless you text or call someone in the next "X number of hours" you will lose your number ! If This was after 6 months of more I could see it... But the way This App works it's like blackmail to keep your phone number... It became such a pain that I removed the app. This is why I made This edit and dropped my rating from 3 stars to 1Star.  I think the "Free" label is false advertising, Free Trial would be closer. If these folks came up with a tiered cost system it could be a workable texting app. But with the $14+ a month price just to use the app without adds or use it or lose it threats, it's not worth it for my use. Why they don't see that  a $20 a year for 250 texts a month or something like that would give them a larger user base and how hard is it to count texts? Software! They have to have This for billing and management anyway.  Look elsewhere if you are just looking for an app to send a text to share a story you found reading the Washington Post with a friend.This App works. It gave me a way to send Text messages from my "Fire Tablet" I wanted to be able to share some news articles without having to use email. I have not used the phone call function. What I don't like is the amount of "Please upgrade!" Messages... I know they have to pay for the service they provide and make at least some profit from the effort. I normally do buy the "no adds" version of any app I use. But the price these guys want is more than what I really use is worth. If you needed the phone call function and if it worked as good as the text function... The the price could be worth it. The only reason I used this app was I didn't want to add Google's play store to my fire, if not for that I would have just used my Google Voice account.

Headings: Why do you keep changing my number????
Base_Reviews: I like the idea of it and the features , but they keep changing my phone number!

Had minimal trouble installing Textme(Kindle Fire Edition), received my NEW phone number, no problems, yet.  Purchased more credits, a little over $15.00 for 1000, text a couple of friends, no problems, yet.  All was going well until, 1)-I tried to enter a new contact.  No joy.  From there all started to go downhill.  2)-had a few missed dialed numbers on the screen tried to delete them according to the online help.  No joy.  3)-lastly, the app stopped, no response, whatever.  So, I deleted the app, and reinstalled.  Went to sign in ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¬ÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ got a response that I entered the wrong info.  Tried again, same response.  I sent my email information to reset password, and waited.  No joy.  I waited about four hours. No joy.  I sent my email information to the rest password, again, three times.  Waited 3 days. I checked my email , according to the information on the screen. Nope.  4)-I tried to make a new account on the Kindle Fire HDX, got response  there is an account with that information. 5)-Okay, I logged on the internet site and got a response that I entered the wrong info. Therefore, I made a new account using the original email address and password.  Logged in to the internet site, bingo looks good.  Went to my Kindle Fire HDX, signed in to the site.  No Joy.This information is not to be negative, but to help others and me.  I am out the money, and I am going to delete the app.Regards

Headings: BE CAREFUL OF SIGNING UP FOR THE PREMIUM SERVICE
Base_Reviews: I bought a Kindle Fire 8 HD this year and began looking at ways to use it besides just Kindle. I had given up my VOIP landline phone service so decided to look for an app to use on the tablet as a replacement.  I chose this one.  I decided to go ahead and buy the premium service so I could keep the number and use this as a backup to replace the VOIP in case something failed with my cell phone.I tested it out and found that it worked ok but I needed to use headset to hear clearly.  This was about a month ago.  Today I needed to use it and when I opened the app on the tablet, it did not recognize my account and wanted to start me as a new user.  So I went online on my PC to their web site and it would not let me log in with the Username and Password I used to set up the account.  I also could not access support without logging in!?!I am having other troubles right now and am not in the mood to wrangle with software/app problems so I deleted the app from the tablet.  It turned out to be really squirrelly so keep this in mind.  It may work ok as a free app; I'm just not willing to deal with now.

Continuing on I entered the info it asked of me including my age which again I decided was for advertising purposes. I was sure I would be bombarded with ads since the app was "free".  I sent a text to my son's iPhone first since I was sure he was going to tell me all the reasons why I should've installed this app.  As soon as I sent the text more ads than I could have imagined flooded the page.  I had to search for the text response from my son which simply said "where did this number come from, what did you do"? Haha!  I decided all this 'free" wasn't worth it. I uninstalled the app right then.  I do want to text from my Kindle Fire so I'll keep looking for a compatable app where I can hopefully use my own phone number.

Headings: A not so mobile mobile app.
Base_Reviews: While the workflows for this app feel better than the PC version of the software, the app is severely limited by it's requirement for an internet connection.  I started using the app at work, which luckily has WiFi, however as my device has no cellular connectivity, I have been unable to use it during my recent travels, nor will I be able to use it to study during the 12+ hours it will take to fly Germany,With the Kindle Fire version of the App, the only apparent need for the internet connection is to sync your progress to the Rosetta Stone servers,  which is useful if you are going back and forth between your PC and mobile device while learning.  However, even this functionality does not work reliably; in my experience the App and PC only synced automatically every third or forth attempt.  While the PC has a force sync option this is not available on the mobile app so you are forced to restart the application through the device settings and hope that your PC synced properly at home.With these issues in mind and the fact that I like to use my Kindle while away from work or home, I wish the Rosetta Stone would have chosen a different method to generate a micro purchase income from their users; such as charging a one time fee to download the App, or charging for some of their more advanced online services.  The fact that I can't use the App as a a true mobile learning platform is endlessly irksome.I also wish that Rosetta stone had built in better orientation support for the app.  I have yet to figure out how the app is determining it's orientation for the session, but more often than not, the app will be incorrectly positioned in relation to how I wish to hold my device.  This is especially troublesome when attempting to use the app while charging the device.TL:DR - While the orientation problems with the app can be annoying, the biggest limiting factor is the requirement for an internet connection.  Which if you are using a device without cellular support effectively makes your mobile device about as portable as your home PC.

Headings: That's fine since I can only use one at a time
Base_Reviews: I have a problem with Rosetta Stone. I have Apple and Google devices. I can login to RS on one device at a time. That's fine since I can only use one at a time. BUT Rosetta Stone requires me to have a separate license for Google. I must pay them a second time for the Android device. It's not because different people might be using both devices at the same time, because both devices can't be logged in at the same time. When you can only use one device at a time you should not have to pay double to have a choice of which device to use. I'd rate RS at less than one star if it would let me. I'm not buying anymore languages until they change this feature.

Headings: Do NOT buy, try something else
Base_Reviews: I bought the full Rosetta Stone and installed it onto my computer along with the apps on my devices so that I could continue practicing Chinese. I went through levels 1 and 2 each in one day. I figured that as the levels increased they would get harder. As I went through all 5 levels I realized that they did not introduce much for new vocabulary from one level to the next. The difficulty was also just as hard from level 1 all the way up to level 5. I had quickly completed all of the levels and after a couple weeks decided to contact Rosetta Stone to get my money back. I say that if you really want to learn a language stay away from this course. I've had a much more difficult time learning through other sources. Rosetta Stone is not challenging nor will it introduce you to much. I tried the Portuguese version as well and it was just like the Chinese, even with the words and sentences used.

The app itself works great. In a lot of ways, it is better than the desktop application. You can push through the lessons quickly on a tablet and the voice recognition on tablets seems to work really well. That's where the good traits end. I spent a lot of money on levels 1-5 (the French desktop application). 3 months of "online" access were included. That means in 3 months, I can't use this app anymore unless I pay even more money to access the features and course progress I have already paid for in the desktop version. If you're going to go with Rosetta Stone for learning another language, it's a great program. But don't count on being able to readily use this app. I believe you need another, separate subscription for any other languages you're learning (and have likely already paid for). The subscription is annual, so you will have to resubscribe every year if you plan on taking more than a year to learn the language or just want to brush up on your skills. Unless you're willing to pony up more dough for the subscription or just go with the online access itself and be willing to let that expire at some point, save yourself the trouble and get the desktop version. It's expensive, but it's also pretty good. Either that or, depending on the language, try something that is absolutely free like Duolingo first (also very good).

I love TED. I've been a fan for years. However, this app is abysmal.  I have never had problems streaming any videos on my network, but this particular app, on my Fire TV Stick CANNOT stream any videos, it's buffering very slowly. I wasn't able to watch even ONE talk with it.Not sure if it's Fire TV stick, or the app to blame, it's probably both.

While I love the content, the app which I downloaded to my Amazon FireStick today just doesn't work. I've seen other reviewers describing the same problem: When I select a talk to watch, it plays for 1 second and then an error says something like "this video has been paused due to a network error". Then I click ok, and click play, and the video starts. But the red circling hourglass indicator remains on screen as I watch and will not go away. Soon the error occurs again, and again I press play and again the hourglass stays on as I watch the program. My bandwidth is variable, but it isn't low. When I test it, I always find my test app sees 10 Mbps on the first run, 20 Mbps on the second, 24 Mbps on the run after that, and about 34 Mbps on a fourth test. So my impression is that my phone company (AT&T) always gives up to 10 Mbps a new stream, and then bumps it up if the demand continues. Also if I try streaming HD video on another devices or if I don't, it makes no difference in the TED app errors, and the video on the other devices works perfectly regardless of whether the TED app is running.  So I conclude the app isn't able to handle changes in throughput, even though all my other devices and apps (with one app exception) work fine. I suppose it's also possible that AT&T is using software to sabotage the app, but that seems extremely unlikely in my opinion. So fix this app!
