Headings: Another Useless App That Requires a Cable Provider
Base_Reviews: What exactly is the point of a streaming app that requires a provider connection? If I already have a provider service, that probably has a DVR device, this app (and the service it provides) is completely useless. NBC Sports, please hop into the present and provide a true streaming app.No one needs cable any more so drop the provider requirement and join the new paradigm.

We are trying to watch the olympics with the app and they show the same commercials in the same order over and over and over again, and about every 5 minutes! It is to the point of cruelty and torture, really. It makes me not want to watch anymore. They even interrupt the events!!  I don't ever want to buy or support Koch, eat McDonalds, use IHC, or watch Mamma Mia ever!!  The way they are forcing the ads is definitely having a negative effect that I am sure the sponsors did not intend and are not paying for.

All the time. I can't clear the error.In the past few days, I have uninstalled the app an reinstalled it numerous times... all in some combination of rebooting my Fire TV, deactivating my account, signing out of my NBC Sports account on my laptop and Chromebook and yelling at my TV.Short of resetting the Fire TV to the factory default (not ready to go nuclear to watch the Premier League without fake sound) there is nothing I can do to correct this problem.  I've wasted hours trying to fix an issue that is not mine.I have sent this same message and photos to support@nbcsports.com.  It is NBC's responsibility to develop an app that works, and it is Amazon's responsibility to offer and distribute products that are promised to work.

Headings: Terrible app/experience; can't access live content because of technical problems with subscription authentication requirement
Base_Reviews: The app says I can get access to content if I'm a Dish Network subscriber (I am) and my Dish programming includes NBC Sports (it does). So I:1. Got an activation code through the NBC app (Android version running in Amazon Fire).2. Entered it at nbcsports.com/activate3. Received this message: "Congratulations, you've successfully activated your device and can now watch NBC Sports. It may take a moment for your device to update. You have access to NBC Sports video from the following networks: NBCSN . . . ."4. Then this message from the app: ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ¬ÃÂÃÂYou do not have a subscription to view the requested content. To upgrade your programming go to mydish.com/programming and then log back in to view content.ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ¬Support from Androidtv@nbcdigital.zendesk.com and support@nbcsports.com was useless. They said "In order to view live content in the NBC Sports app, you need to have a cable subscription that includes the USA network." My Dish Network programming does include the USA Network. So I'm not allowed to watch NBC's commercial-saturated lives sports programming because I have Dish instead of cable? That makes no sense.

Headings: Not Working on any of my Fire TV devices.
Base_Reviews: I have been using this app for over a year and about two or three weeks ago it has stopped working on any of my Fire TV devices. The app loads but all I get is a cryptic message "an error has occurred". I have tried every suggestion and nothing has worked.

It's too bad that the people at the NHL and NBC Sports have not figured out that customers are trying to use these apps because they have cut their cables. Many customers, like myself, are tired of paying large bills for unwatched stations while cable prices continue to climb. I am a huge Pittsburgh Penguins fan and wanted to watch the post season games, but the NHL and stations like NBC will only grant access to the games if customers provide their cable company information. If these stations don't catch on soon, they will get left behind, like newspapers and video rental companies The Internet has changed everything. NBC can either adapt or become irrelevant. More and more people are cutting their cable connections. If NBC wants to have customers, then it needs to grant people access to the games who don't have cable. I deleted the NBC app from all of my devices. Hopefully, Root Sports or the NHL will come through for fans. Then NBC will be a distant memory, like Block Busters.

I'd like to write a review, except the app doesn't work... at all... on multiple FireTV devices and models. both the original model and 4k 2nd generation.It simply says:ERRORAn error has occurred.Even after clearing the cache and uninstalling and reinstalling, nada. Bupkis.What really pisses me off is that a quick online search reveals that this is a common problem that has been going on for close to a year. I want my money back for my Gold subscription.

I've tried it at home, at work, at my parents house, and at friend's houses. It's not supposed to used the SSO for cable cable provider authentication, but I've tried using credentials from multiple providers anyway in case they were trying to make the switch.I've tried it on devices spanning three different generations of FireTV.It's not functional on ANYTHING. When you click open, you get the NBC logo with a spinning yellow circle for approx 1 second, then a message that says:ErrorAn error has occured.Options from that point are cancel or retry.This persists after clearing of cache and data, reinstalling the application, and even resetting the firestick to defaults.When you finally do get through to NBC support, they say they're working with Amazon to find the problem. That's the same thing they told me during the Boxing Day games, December 26th.UPDATE: This app still does not work. 7 months later the exact same error persists across all Amazon Fire TV devices.

Headings: If you're getting errors read this!  Poorly deployed app, but they have the monopoly...
Base_Reviews: If you're getting an error when opening the app, or loading content, you can't have any ad blockers active.  Bypass your PIHole, remove ad blockers from computer, whatever. That fixes the problem.As for the app, it sucks. The ads are as every 1-star review describes, constant, unrelenting, and repetitive. Hockey games aren't so bad, but the Olympics were terrible.  Needing a subscription is expected, but a cable account is ridiculous. Just give a non-cable cutter friend or family a few bucks and use their account. The app is slow and sluggish. Just have to deal with that.  I would say use every means necessary to circumvent the traditional "Pay us to watch, watch our advertising, and we'll black out what we want" mentality of the networks. There are lots of options out there. The sooner everyone ditches the status quo and hits their pocketbooks, the sooner they'll revamp the pay structure to get customers back.Cancel Netflix.

Headings: ZERO stars. Awful, terrible, does not work!
Base_Reviews: I have this app on 5 Raspberry Pi's, and I also have it on 5 Amazon FireTV sticks.I *have* a cable account- so I have a valid login. Up to now it has worked fairly well on the RPi's, but as of today it is completely and utterly non-functional.It never *ever* worked on any of the Fire sticks. Never. It is authenticated with my provider, it just doesn't work.I'm not in my home state right now, so I would like to be able to watch the baseball games I am entitled to watch when I am at home. I pay for cable. It is supposed to work. I am supposed to be able to stream my Mets games anywhere in the country. Not once since I've been away from my home territory have I been able to stream a Mets game. No matter what team they are playing against, I just get an error telling me the game is blacked out in my area. Every. Single. Game.Since this app comes from the Amazon play store, I expect the damn thing to work. Why have it there otherwise? Just look at the reviews. This has got to be the most godawful piece of coding in the history of computing.FIX the damn thing or remove it. Funny how I can stream Yankees games using the Fox Sports Go app on all my devices, without a hiccup. Too bad I'm not a Yankees fan...

NBC sports and sports gold are terrible. It makes you re activate your device through your computer or phone multiple times which is a pain. You get your TV set up, then suddenly in a couple of weeks, you have to re activate.  That requires your computer and signing into NBC sports each time with a special code. And sometimes the announcer is drowned out by the road noise(cycling). The announcing staff is terrific for cycling. One other issue, I only care about one sport which I pay for(cycling) yet I have to continually pick that sport from a drop down of twenty sports even though you have to add them to your package if you want to view them. Another pain. In general I would state that NBC sports is not very consumer friendly.  If you have a problem you email someone and they send you a generic email in return that suggests they didn't read your email very carefully.

No useful content even when it does work. EPL has moved to Peacuck and that is not available on FireStick. Not sure who I should be more angry with NBC or Amazon. Both are fault. NBC won't get my business any more and Amazon is about to lose it.-Previous Review- They did finally do something to fix it after 2 months . . .Worked fine for months (and still does on one FireStick). Last week, I received the same error described by many others. Tried clearing, cache, then data, then uninstalling, then resetting Firestick to factory defaults. Got it to work for a few minutes. The installed other apps, and the error returned.

I installed the app, signed onto my service provider and everything was working great.The next time I tried to login, i just get the "Error An error has occurred" message and can't do anything.  I did everything that was recommended,  resetting the Fire TV Cube, clearing the data/cache, and fore stopping the App.Seems to be a consistent problem and the only known solution online is to do a hard reset on the device.  That is terrible.  Works fine on Playstation and Apple TV....

I've tried over and over to view live sports broadcasts using this app on my Amazon Fire, but never been able to.  I receive their confirmation that my subscription is approved after activating the account and confirming my provider connection (Sling TV), but then wait forever for the screen to update as promised.  It never happens.  I've contacted them for assistance and spent countless fruitless minutes following their suggestions to complete the connection, but it never helps.  Even though I've received subscription confirmation numerous times, each attempt to view a live broadcast is rejected with the notice that I need to upgrade my subscription.  No information is given how to do that, and their technical support folks don't offer any such advice.

This NBC Sports app flat out does not work.  I have two firesticks and am holding onto a basic cable account just to use apps like this, and it has not worked for months!  You login, the screen never updates, you try every combination you can think of but you always end up getting this 'An error has occurred' message.  It 100% does not work, and neither Amazon nor NBC have any response or seem to care at all.  I am shocked at such a major network/product has this little effort or care for what would be a highly used app.  FYI, for golf events I've found ways to use the Internet browser and manually go to the video stream URL, which sometimes works, sometimes not.  Ended up buying a Roku just to avoid this frustration.

NBC could not care less about their streaming app or the people who pay to watch it's content. Words cannot describe my hatred of NBC Sports and this application but I will try, for the people. First off, it is so full of bugs and glitches that it makes for a truly frustrating watching experience. There is no escape, however, as they have you by the balls owning the exclusive rights to some of the best sporting available.  You will have to sign in and verify your credentials to the app so many times, I have nbcsports.com/activate as one of my most visited websites. Once you've gained access to the content you willing pay for it gets even better. There is nothing quite like waking up at 7am eastern standard time to watch some Premier League football only to have the app tell you it is unable to play this asset over and over again. If you are watching a sport that a decent amount of commercial breaks be prepared to have quick cuts to those commercials, so quick in fact that parts of the game will be cut off.  Also be prepared to see the exact same commercials for an entire year/season. You will be reciting the Liberty Mutual ads by heart in no time. Games will lag so far behind normal game time that you have to actively avoid your phone to not see spoilers. To be clear this not an internet speed issue as I pay for decent download/upload speeds. If you love sports you will find this app as a necessary evil, but it will suck out as much of your soul as possible and then charge you the NBC Gold price doing so.

Headings: Terrible functionality. I would rather watch a less than legal stream
Base_Reviews: This app is terrible. I cannot find any way to turn on closed captioning. The playback controls are basically worthless. While watching the NHL West Final, I paused the game and intended to fast forward during the commercial break to catch up. Turns out it is impossible to rewind or fast forward. Ended up missing two goals when we went back to the live game.

Where do I start with a review of the NBC Sports app? It works, so that's a plus. There are many other apps out there for sports, but not any others which play NBC Sports, such as the Olympics. Other apps allow one to organize the offerings based on the league and date. There is no such organization with this one. Instead, you get a scrolling list of live events, a list of replayed events, and highlights. And NBC, which advertised that you can watch the Olympics anywhere and anytime, didn't bring this functionality to the Fire TV Stick. Not impressed.

NBC sports runs terribly during live events. They require you to have a paid subscription to watch half the events you follow under one sport wether you are linked to your cable provider or not. During live events the streaming tends to jitter and jump or just all out crash so you have to restart the app and go back to what you were watching. Absolutely a waste of time.  No search feature available to find events, backing to arrow through  is ridiculous. Beyond that, all you have is NBCs "highlights"  edit and worthless commentary; with more commercial length than actual event coverage.  I long for the days when ABC was the leader in sports coverage. Live events, factual and to the point auditories, and no political or broadcast politics. It has 1 star because I cannot rate it lower. In diving it would rate a failed dive.

Imagine a world where you can watch the Olympics on your favorite streaming device. Like, I dunno, your Amazon Fire Stick. Well, after downloading the NPC Sports app to do just that, I am still left imagining. I configured it with my cable subscription credentials to authorize my access to the rich pagentry of the Olympic games (and why this step is necessary when I get my internet access through my cable service is beyond me, but I digress...). Anyway, after launching the app, I was able to watch every trailer, athlete interview, promo, and sports advertisement related to the Olympics -- just not the actual Olympic games themselves. No curling in this house. No downhill skiing with this app. Not one moment of the heart-pounding thrill I expected from cross-country flaming luge skating that had so captured my hopes this year. If you're into watching droll (read: not at all droll) NBC talking heads drone on about sports cliches, this is the app for you. But don't expect to watch an actual sports with it.

Headings: NBC Sports Does Not Make the Podium.
Base_Reviews: We purchased NBC Sports so we could watch the Olympics.  There are only about 2 weeks of this special event and then another 4 years wait till the next set of Winter Olympics.  We wanted to indulged! Since NBC owns the broadcasting rights to the Olympics, this seemed like a smart, simple purchase.  We quickly learned this was neither smart or simple.  'Error' resulted in missing what was supposed to be ice skating when the programming froze for more than 20 minutes.  Morning televised programs are aired again later in the day.  (102 events people!!! Why replay the SAME ones?!?!). And in some random competition with itself, NBC will show one event on NBC Sports and a completely different event on NBC...So, I can watch what I paid for or watch what is free through my TV antennae.  ???  There 92 nations competing in 102 events, and preliminaries to some of those events, and semifinals for some of those events...It thought I would be able to see all of the Olympics with this purchase.  Clearly, I was mistaken.

Headings: Consistent buffering even with 100 MBPS speeds.
Base_Reviews: I use this app primarily for streaming F1 and NHL games but recently it's been barely usable. The buffering I experience is only with this application. I even purchased a new Fire TV upgrading from a gen 1 Fire Stick thinking it could be the issue but nope. Zero issues when streaming Netflix, HBOGO, Showtime but NBCSN... buffers all the time. Live, replays, you name it, buffering. Other devices I use in the same location are getting 100+ MBPS speeds so buffering shouldn't be an issue if it wasn't for the application itself. Streaming from the NBCSN website on my laptop doesn't seem to hiccup so once again must be app related. Can't wait for F1 to have their own streaming service so I ditch this garbage application and gladly pay someone to have a good quality app/stream.

Pixelated games of hockey are hard to watch cause you can't see the puck.  Freezes up almost every game towards the end of the game. Super annoying when it's a game in overtime. Then I restart it to try and get it going and end up having to watch commercials and then I miss the end. It has happened so many times crazy.On the "Live" page,  the start time of games disappears and a "play" emoji appears, way before the game starts.They also have been playing the same ONE commercial for over a year.  Yeah, I've been a customer for like 2 years and the same commercial has been the only commercial they use.

Headings: Dreadful in a Moment of Need
Base_Reviews: In a moment of need the App was dreadful. The App failed to load on a number of attempts. When it would load it would crash and go back to a spinning gear and ultimately not initiate. I am not sure if the network was completely overwhelmed. I do know it was not my internet access as other Apps and programs would load and work flawless.

Headings: Critical function doesn't work and no evidence NBC even considers it a problem.
Base_Reviews: I purchased to watch bike races.  The presumed ability to play back the original "live" sequence.  I can do that from the web.  I cannot do it on a Fire TV.  I reported the problem and the NBC response doesn't even recognize the discrepancy or accept this as an issue.  The Fire TV will play "highlights" that I don't want to see, but I cannot play a delayed version of the original race from a Fire TV.I guess if you're going to watch NASCAR or some other &@#^&*% like that...

Headings: Don't get this if you want any NBC Golf or Golf Channel coverage.--there is absolutely nothing
Base_Reviews: I got the app primarily for the golf portion. I just checked the app -Jan 21, 8:12 AM. There is literally nothing as far as golf. Nothing  in "Featured, Live & Upcoming. Highlights- only thing was 2 very dated highlights.The "Highlights" was embarrassing.  One of the highlights was 17 seconds long and it started out with a 30 second Chevy commercial.Please don't get me wrong. Huge fan of Amazon. Prime member,  I have 2 kindles, 2 firesticks.

Headings: Liked that the offered Superbowl 52 for free
Base_Reviews: Liked that the offered Superbowl 52 for free. Very disappointed with quality of the video stream. The plays were very blocky/lagged and the annoying interruptions that the presentation would resume momentarily were frustrating. It was almost as if they were hiding/overwriting commercials or covering for worse lag. Wish I would have watched it somewhere else. Hopefully they will do better with the Olympics, or I may have to setup an Over-The-Air antenna again (last one was destroyed by hurricane).

Headings: Won't recognize credentials like your email, so why bother?!
Base_Reviews: Went through the entire process 5 TIMES, and would get to the last step and get redirected either toA) login page that would not accept my verified credentials, orB) NBC Sports, because SportsGold was being moved over to that...and then go through the whole process again.Horrible and ineffective; even my friend who works for a major cable and internet provider in IT management would not get the apps to work on his devices, so don't even try blaming the end user on this one!

I gave it one star because I had to in order to post. I don't know how this got ordered on my account. I am the only one that should have access to this account and I definitely DID NOT order it. I don't even care for sports. I contacted them about it but haven't received a response.

Headings: Cannot get it to work with Amazon Firestick!
Base_Reviews: This channel works with our TV/ Roku. I can't get it to interface with or TV with the Amazon Firestick, keeps asking for our TV provider to proceed with the setup. We don't have a TV Provider. I have not found a way around that. The picture quality lags from time to time, and stays blurry 70% of the time. For a $75 Supercross subscription (5 months), so far I am extremely unimpressed. I will update this review if things turn around and get better.

Based on what I've read, this issue is not limited to Fire TV users. More often than not live programming that should be available (and IS available on my iPad app) pops the "unable to play this asset" message instead.  I might add, the overall user interface leaves much to be desired. Let us hope somebody at NBC Universal - Comcast gets a clue.Now, a few hours later the message is "user must reauthenticate". I did. Multiple times.I'm done.  Deleted the app.The one star should be minus 6 stars.

Headings: I've rated this app poorly mostly due to terrible streaming performance
Base_Reviews: I've rated this app poorly mostly due to terrible streaming performance. How I came to use this app and my experience is as follows: I recently gave traditional cable the boot and have been using PlayStation VUE for TV service. The most recent NASCAR race was not available on the NBCSN channel but was available through this app. I was curious how well this app would work for a live sporting event and decided to give it a shot. I searched for the app via Fire TV's universal search and was able to find it with ease. Upon installation you have to go through an activation process that requires you to prove you have a cable, or similar, provider; this is not unlike many other pay tv channel applications. Once I completed activation, via a computer, the app was instantly accessible. The interface is sparse yet straightforward and I was able to quickly find the race and stream it. Unfortunately, it would stream for about 5 minutes then pause and show a buffering icon, there was no way to get the content to continue streaming without restarting. Upon restart everything worked properly again... ...for about five minutes and then everything froze. I repeated this process four times with the same result. My Fire TV's WiFi signal is listed as, "very good," and other streaming services I use (Netflix, PlayStation VUE) worked fine. I was excited to give this application a try, but don't see it as a viable option for watching live content at this point.  I plan to test it again at some point and see if the experience changes.

Hi. Not seeing medals ceremonies has been unsatisfying... and re runs 2 times a day with waay too many commercials take away from all of the the splendid athletes who get no air time.. ...Commentators talk way too much during events, and supportive comments after performances are uplifting for All of Humanity... Headings: 5 minute stupid countdown clock then no more views.
Base_Reviews: I couldn't watch the Olympics more than 5 minutes because they had a dumb countdown clock then we had to sign in using our provider and my provider is a dope "Frontier" and they don't help you sign in to a lost password in the middle of the night and the idea or calling customer service and being on hold for an hour... so I missed the Olympics.

Headings: HAS NOT WORKED FOR MONTHS, NO RESOLUTION FROM NBC SPORTS OR AMAZON
Base_Reviews: I have been streaming from NBC Sports off the Firestick for over almost 2 years, and it seems like once they released their new interface, everything went downhill. I have 2 Firesticks. The app never opens now, on either, and shows the message "An Error has occurred" on the screen, and the only true option is to quit the app. I have been able to get into the app MAYBE 3 times since maybe October, but around 99% of the time I can't get into the app now. I have uninstalled, reinstalled, cleared caches & data, nothing will work. I have contacted both Amazon and NBC Sports support and neither have helped.

When trying to activate the app, you are required to sign in with your carrier.  They are not talking about the carrier of your internet, rather which company allows usage of apps on your devices.  The Sports Gold is the app for streaming devices i.e. Roku, Fire TV, Apple TV, etc.

The app says I'm not authorized, yet in working with NBCSports customer support they say it should work. They investigated and found no reason why it won't let me watch the SF Giants games. I am a subscriber and my Cable company confirms it. It has been several months. I was promised it would be fixed by the All Star Game.... Well promise broken!! No streaming available as of 7-13-17 AS game was 2 days ago! NBCSportsBA App is only for SF bay area! All others in market area are SOL

This app is a joke. 1st I am directed to  enter device code on line, then sign in via cable provider (Comcast), Hey, Success!!But then the app says, "Oops, it looks like you are not subscribed to this channel, contact your service provider"Well guess what..I AM subscribed! - I even get NBC sports ON MY CABLE box!Bonus fact:  I just want to watch only on-line content, which you can freely watch on-line with no subscription.100% FAIL

Bought the app to watch golf programing. At the beginning it worked well, plenty to watch.Then the quality got bad, one one tv the quality was good, other tv the picture would go from clear to blurry.Towards the end of my year, the programming got less and less, golf coverage was limited to featured groups only, never complete coverage of tournaments. Wasn't worth watching! Really socked for golf which is all I bought it for!
The only thing u can watch is synchronized swimming or bowling. Everything you want to watch is blacked out, not supported or an additional charge. No thanks.

Headings: Needs improvement for streaming local sports.
Base_Reviews: Downloaded the App to watch my local teams play, but the streaming can be pretty spotty. Sometimes the stream will freeze every few moments and can make the experience unwatchable. I was bouncing back and forth from the Fox Sports app while watching the World Series and only the NBC Sports app gave many any problems...not surprisingly all the commercials play just fine without any interference. I pay for 100 Mbps internet and have been able to stream live sports well from other apps, but the NBC Sports app needs to step it up when it comes to streaming local games.

Olympic coverage is constantly buffering, even during the commercials. And when content is playing, half the time the screen is so blurry it's practically unwatchable. All of these problems occur even though I have average speeds of ~150Mbps, so the bandwidth problem is on NBC's end. Additionally, the app interface is repetitive and difficult to navigate to the content I want to actually see.

Although I was able to authenticate through my Playstation Vue subscription, the app is absolute crap. There is no rewind feature, and the viewer is inundated with the same commercial every few minutes - often interrupting the athlete's performance. Note to sponsors - I WILL NEVER, EVER BUY TIDE OR SHOP AT OLD NAVY AGAIN BECAUSE I'M SO SICK OF HEARING YOUR NAME. Complete epic fail!!! I very much like that I can stream Sunday night football... but it is SO glitchy!  Often throughout programming, it buffers and repeats what has already been played - which in and of itself is annoying but then when this happens a few times, the lag between what is being watched and real time is considerable. I only use this to catch up on F1 racing. I have to go through the process of re-registering my devices (roku and Apple TV) just about every week. This means going on the internet, entering the unique code and waiting...waiting...waiting for the app to unlock itself AGAIN. Super annoying!

Headings: App is extremely limited vs browser version
Base_Reviews: A sporting event I am watching through my computer browser on the NBC Sports stream site shows as unavailable on the app. For some reason, the app doesn't show anything that's not on your local NBC channel. I'm trying to watch a nationally televised game, but my local NBC channel is showing a local game instead. Skip the app and use the browser, but only if you must. If you can watch the event on ANY other platform than NBC, use that instead.

Signed in using my cable provider (Verizon Fios) and activation was successful. Access is denied when attempting to watch all past Olympic events. Called Amazon customer service and they couldn't help at all. This proves to me that app streaming technology is not there yet. Just look up the schedule and set your DVR like the old days.
Tried to watch the Winter NHL game and was blocked unless I paid an additional fee. False advertising about the features of the Firestick benefits!
wanted to see my UK soccer matches.couldNOT interface at all.No proper instructions could be found!!will cancel

Headings: This was a disservice to pro Motocross and Supercross.
Base_Reviews: This was one of the weakest strems I've paid for. Usability was a challenge. When it stopped showing the main competition, it went to still shots and it was hard to know where things were in the competition next. There was only background sound. The interface was very large on the best of equipment, even with commercial internet from my business. When Supercross went to NBC with this program it lost a lot of viewers and I understand why.
Application would not let me connect even with my correct service provider. Customer service responded but was unable and unwilling to look further
This app is one that you need to sign in under your cable provider for it to work. My cable provider, Charter/Spectrum is not supported for this app so I am unable to use it. Very disappointed!

Headings: Purchased the Fire Stick to watch 2016 Olympics on my ...
Base_Reviews: Purchased the Fire Stick to watch 2016 Olympics on my TV.  I have the app on my android devices and can watch live events full coverage and complete archived events.  However, with the Fire Stick, I can only watch highlights from NBC Sports coverage.  Even after I logged in with my cable provider and entered the required code.  The stick works for NetFlix, but I already had a device the ran NetFlix.  I feel I was cheated because there was no indication that I could not use this app for the desired purpose.  It has the same logo, the same name.  But it's NOT the same app.
Paid for the gold PLL pass for the app and it suddenly stopped loading. Keeps saying An Error Has Occured. Will not allow sign in. Customer service keeps telling me to do same thing over and over.

I have Time Warner for basic channels, but don't want to pay a ton for channels I won't need.  Turns out, since I don't subscribe to the package that includes a bunch of garbage channels that also includes NBC Sports, I can't use this app. I know it's a CYA for the providers so they can keep people attached to cable, but I'm just going to cancel it all and get one of these small internet only providers for a quarter of the price if I can't watch on here. Look at all the add revenue they're missing on the Olympics by blocking anyone without a higher tier sports package.

Wanted to stream the nfl game and it only provides a 45 minute preview?  I'll be god damned if I'm gonna pay to watch something that should be broadcast locally!  It's no wonder people resort to hacking into broadcasts!

Headings: the reminder feature is nice and it's a fairly easy app to navigate
Base_Reviews: I realize it's a "free" app, but a commercial every other minute?  And the same commercial time after time?  It makes it hard to watch the events, especially fast paced ones. And the fact that you have to have an actual cable subscription limits its use tremendously for those of us who choose not to have cable (that's why I have a Firestick and Internet after all). However, the reminder feature is nice and it's a fairly easy app to navigate.

NBC needs to fix this app. It keeps crashing, and each time the only way to fix it is to completely reset my firestick (even wiping the data from the app and re-installing it doesn't work). Then I have to re-download all the apps onto the firestick. When it's working it's fine; I pay for NBC Sports Gold so I can watch Premier League games, and it's great for that. But it crashes fairly often and then everything has to be wiped and reset.

Headings: It crashed quite a few times until I took the ...
Base_Reviews: It crashed quite a few times until I took the fire stick out and plugged it back in. Then it cooperated for the most part but would still crash at times. I mainly got it to watch the Olympics.  I don't know if they normally show 10,000 commercials but they certainly did during the Olympics

Headings: Terrible but really the only way to actually watch the Olympics.
Base_Reviews: Lots of commercials even though I can only watch since I'm already paying for cable, not all replays are available for every sport, have to re log in every day and a mediocre interface. The one upside is it's the only way to actually watch most of the events nbc was supposed to be showing olympics coverage on 5 cable channels but usually only has actual sports on one at any given time. Apparently reruns of NCIS and their last place cable news coverage is more important.

Headings: Great picture quality - Very very poor app stability
Base_Reviews: The NBC Sports for FIRETV app stability could be improved by a lot. Although the video quality is amazing, the stream often drops and almost every time after an ad, the app just crashes an goes back to the beginning of video out of nowhere. This could get very annoying when this happens over and over again. I would give the app 5 star without doubt if the app was not crashing so frequently after fast forwarding or advertisement.

Not what I expected from it.  I use it for supercross, and there has been a few times practice and qualifying was not streaming.  The picture quality seems to lag on the live stream.  I wont be purchasing again that's for sure.

Headings: Pretty much useless and support is virtually non existent
Base_Reviews: Will not play anything except short clips.  Attempted to get assistance from NBC and they said to delete and reinstall the app.  Did that and still can't watch a full event.  Pretty much useless and support is virtually non existent.

Headings: This makes the app almost useless to watch an event from start to finish without ...
Base_Reviews: While trying to watch the olympics live the app will pause it if you need to leave the room, but will not let you fastword to catch up. What happens is after the event is complete it will cut the feed, even though you are in the middle of it. This makes the app almost useless to watch an event from start to finish without missing anything. The app should provide the same functionality as my live dish network which allows for pausing and fastwording during the broadcast.

Could've been so much more...

Headings: UPDATED 10/27/2017  App has been turned into a disaster
Base_Reviews: 10/27/2017 Installed latest version to see if it makes any difference. The new version obliterated any hope for a better app. Gone is a simple categorization of sport. Now you have to search through 80+ replays all thrown together. Soccer next to football next to racing...who's the idiot who thinks this is better?It's now choppier than ever. I've cleared cache, deleted apps, restart my firetv numerous times, rebooted my router, even turned off every device on our network and still cuts out 1 second of every 8 to 10 seconds of  replay broadcast.  AWFUL!10/23/16: an hour later, while the USGP Race was on, I had come back inside to watch something else, and as the screen refreshed...there it was...So I watched the second half of the race live...will need to go back and watch the start later.10/23/16:  Today, the day of the USGP F1, the app now doesn't have the Live Event for today's USGP nor does it have the replay of Qualifying (watched it live yesterday).  Not sure what goes on behind the scenes, but this has been the trend all year...we on the viewer side call it annoying/flaky/unreliable...among our colorful turretic episodes...This App is awesome!  Replay live events you missed, Great extra insight presentations!  This is awesome!Old Post @900 am 06/17/2016...rated 1 star at the time...they fixed within 6 hours!:Liked this app until near two weeks ago.  F1 episodes that are broadcast on television do not play.  Error message 'Parental Controls prohibit this from being viewed'...I have verified there are no Parental Setting on by FireStick.  Spoke with Amazon Tech Support...they verified it was not a credential issue. Episodes that are Practice 1 & 3 play fine...Practice 2, Qualifying, and the Race itself (even re-broadcast...and live events) do not play.  HEY NBC Sports...is this tied to a rating on the broadcast at all???  Is there some category, G, PG, NR, etc that is not being applied...anything of value (and what the sponsors want us to see) are not able to be viewed.

Headings: OK for superbowl. Can't watch Olympics.
Base_Reviews: OK for superbowl.  Had to close and reopen app a lot to get back into streaming.  Most superbowl adds were missing.  Can't watch Olympics without a TV subscription.
Repeated error message across TVs and platforms. They should have done better.

Headings: We were a whole 5 mins behind during the Super Bowl because it just kept freezing and spinning
Base_Reviews: The app freezes a lot and when it does come back on the picture is fuzzy and grainy for a Few minutes. We were a whole 5 mins behind during the Super Bowl because it just kept freezing and spinning.

Headings: The app is fine-ish, programming could use tweaking
Base_Reviews: The times shown are not relative to current time zone so it makes it difficult to know when to tune in. The app also has a lot of lag in the middle of the events (might be my connection speed, but still) and the damn ads keep coming up while the commentators are still discussing the event and sometimes don't let us see replays.

Unable to connect to my cable account (crashes when I open page to enter my user name and password) - completely useless and no customer service available. Get a ROKU or APPLE TV instead, Amazon's firestick is total crap.

Why offer programming that requires a cable provider?  And the free  30 minute 'preview' of Olympics is a joke.  The point of subscribing to Prime is for watching programs and movies without the cost of a cable service... a d a delay is no problem. Would love a response from an Amazon official as to the benefits.
Got it to watch olympics. It showed a few intro clips and rhat was all. The interface is confusing.
Had some playback issues. Ok interface. I expected a bit more from this app, but that seems to be the case with many similar apps.

Every NBC application that I've used, regardless of Operating System or Hardware, has been absolute garbage.  This one is no different, because like the others, it continues to crash or freeze.  Come on, NBC!!!

To fully utilize this feature, one needs a cable subscription. Doesn't that defeat the whole purpose? Why would one need this app if one had cable? More than willing to pay for the app. Not willing to pay the high cost of cable.

Headings: Streaming the Super Bowl - Epic Fail!
Base_Reviews: I downloaded this app to my Amazon Firestick to watch the Super Bowl. This WAS NOT a good experience!  One of the best parts of the Super Bowl is the commercials.  Some played, but most of the time a generic wallpaper popped up to stand by with a picture of the Opening Ceremony of the Super Bowl.  Then, when the game came back on, the lag and delay was SO BAD that I could hear my neighbors cheering or booing and it took 5 minutes  before I could watch that play.  Overall, a BAD experience and made me want to go back to cable.  Please work on this, I really want to watch the Winter Olympics, but without the delay and constant waiting.

Headings: Works, video quality is good, a few glitches.
Base_Reviews: EDIT: dropping a star.  Was trying to use this to watch the Olympics, but the interface is really not good; a lot of events are labeled as "live," but then when you click on them you get a "slate" (TV jargon) about the event being over; every item you can select starts with a commercial, and then you watch the commercial and end up with a finished event or, often enough, video playback issues that require you to restart it (getting the commercial again) and then getting another fail.  Then there's the titles they were choose.... instead of X vs Y in SPORT as the title, they'd spoil it by saying X defeats Y in SPORT.  The only reason to get this app is because you have no other choices.It worked, and it's not terrible.  We watched the olympic opening ceremony last night; the video quality was generally very good, but there were occasional quality drops, and after some time we'd lose the stream entirely, causing us to go back to the home screen and re-select the video feed; it seems to always start off with a commercial - so you're missing content while you re-acquire the stream.This happened after a couple of hours, so I figured if it would stream that long without a glitch, then it's acceptable - but then it started happening more frequently.  After the third time we switched to another TV that had the cable box on it and just watched the rest uninterrupted.I'd give it one star if I were rating the coverage, though!
Overall it's fine. However, there is a definite lag time. So if you don't mind 1+ minutes behind no big deal.

Headings: Sorry. Not sorry. Free. Not Free.

Headings: Garbage bait nd switch scam app
Base_Reviews: The app simply appears to scan your device for issue and then pops up with an rd to buy their other app in order to clean an optimize your tablet. Why would Amazon even allow this in their app store?
Downloaded this and ran it. It gave me a response then said "add cleaner" so I clicked it and it took me to a 2nd app I had to buy for $4.99.

I feel disappointed because as far as I can tell, it quickly scans and identifies areas that need to be cleaned but you have to pay money in order for the app to actully remove the garbage.  I'm wondeting if I'm missing something or doing something wrong?

I'm sceptical of any device that requires its users to rate it before getting additional apps. I'm also sceptical of apps that don't work. After I cleaned it and it supposedly deleted all the garbage, I tried to rate it by pushing the rating button. Instead I was sent to the cleaning screen. I pushed the button, expecting no garbage since it had just been disposed of, when to my surprise, it still had the same amount of garbage as before. Go figure!!!
It runs a "scan", real or fake... Who knows... Then give you the option to buy if you want your device cleaned. No download needed for that. Charge for the app before download.

Directs you to pay for it before you can even use its features after you scan for the first time. No functions available. Why would I pay for something that doesn't work? These 5 star reviews must be from bots or shameless reviewers that get paid for reviews.

Scam. I thought this was another app (which I had used before) so I didn't bother looking at reviews. What a mistake. This is a bait & switch advertisement. It does nothing of benefit (for the device user, anyway).

For starters, the app is free to download it, but in order to use it to clean anything you must pay $4.29. I've been using my Fire tablet for more than a week. It is difficult to believe the app was only able to find 84 kilobytes of trash to clean. After paying for those silly bytes to be cleaned, I chose "clean." Then I ran the program again and it found the same bytes it had previously cleaned. I may upgrade my review when I see the app actually does something. I've definitely had better results with free cleaner/ optimizers on my android devices.
It scans your device and after scanning shows ,? Would you like to down load cleaner,I thought I just did ,then it tells you ,you have to pay for itNot free
After you install it, it scan your device and it tells you what it found to clean. But if you want to clean it, it makes you pay a subscription fee. I uninstalled immediately.
Its doesnt tell you that's it's a paid app in the description... after it scans your device your required to pay in order for the app to clean and optimize your device

I bought the app after reading some of the reviews and thought it would at least be decent, but it's just a downloaded endless loop of disappointment. The app started up right away, everything was clean quick and right to the point, so of course at first I loved it. Then I went and did the scan on my tablet, and again it was wicked fast and claimed to have found 6 viruses & a few junk files. I think awesome! then I see the button that says "Download Cleaner". So now I'm a little frustrated that I have to go and download ANOTHER app when the name clearly says Optimizer AND &&& Cleaner.So I brush it off and go ahead to download the cleaner except there's no free version of the cleaner. You can look at other people's great reviews about the app but you can't share their joy w/out paying $4 and some change. Whats gonna happen after that? Have to pay another five bucks for every useful tool this app claims to offer?Completely disappointed, this app has been a complete waste of time.
Once it scans device tells you to buy the premium version to fix, scam
If anything, my Fire is slower. Found 4 viruses the first time. 2nd run found 6. No I.D. on viruses or what apps they are attached to. Not worth it to me to even download, much less pay for.
Scans your device then wants money to clean bad files off of system.
kept crashing my kindle

Unless you want to pay, don't waste your time downloading. The FCC should fine these liars. Free download, yeah, but after scanning you have to pay to clean. I hope kindle isn't supporting them or to shame on them too.

This app is a scam. Downloaded and ran it.  It reported there were 3 viruses but if you select the Clean button you are taken to a screen to BUY the ability to clean. I thought maybe it did not install right. So I uninstalled and reinstalled it. Ran the scan and now get a report that says I have 8 viruses. Clean still takes to page to buy cleaner capability.  So, at this point it looks like even the Scan function is a scam, reporting random different results from 2 different installs in less that 5 minutes.  I am surprised Amazon allows this deceptive practice. It appears Amazon does not vet the apps. Very disappointing.
Doesn't actually do anything useful.  The free version is merely an ad for the paid version.
I got this app because my tablet was super slow but all this app did was find stuff!!!!! It DID NOT clean anything at all!!!!!!!!!! DO NOT BUY THIS APP!!!!!
Doesn't so anything, my tablet is still slow and I paid almost $5.00. It keeps saying no garbage. Total rip off!
I have used it twice, hoping to speed up my tablet, I am still having lags
Bait and switch. You have to pay before you can do anything useful. Not free.

Headings: You have to buy it to have it do any cleaning, but they don't tell you that part.
Base_Reviews: Took about 3 seconds to "scan" my entire tablet without any mention of what it is doing.  That was the first red flag.  When it "finishes" it doesn't detail absolutely anything it found.  Just "31 MB of garbage and 7 virus files".  That was the second red flag.  And to round it out, you have to buy it to do anything close to "cleaning" it.  What a rip off.  Sure, they say it offers in app purchases, but they fail to tell you that if you want anything useful like, oh, say, CLEANING THE JUNK, you need to buy it.  Oh, and 'Support Team', don't bother replying to this with your standard reply about how it's really doing 'this' or 'that'.  You misled people, and you only get one chance at a first impression.  And you blew it.

Headings: Pretty sure IT'S the only virus on my Kindle!
Base_Reviews: !This thing download in about 3 second flat,in another 3 seconds it's spun ittiny dial to 100% scanned. THEN it tells me my Kindle ha 14 viruses!!. Yeah...right!. I'm uninstalling it. And I'm do thoroughly disgusted with this sik browser I'm forced to use that I'm replacing this kindle fire with a Galaxy Tab next week.I'm just that tired of this browser,and the limited apps that are compatible with the fire tablet.

Headings: False Advertising, No Proof of changes
Base_Reviews: Product says it is a FREE OPTIMIZER & CLEANER - it is not. It does a free scan and THEN you have to pay (IN THE APP) to get the optimizer and cleaner. I was a fool and used my coins to continue... and I cannot return & refund. This is bait & switch. If people bought it through the site/store, they could get a refund when they see the app does nothing. But if you use coins, you are now stuck with a brick they claim fixed your kindle - but since it does not provide any information on what it did, you have no way of knowing.As a matter of fact, when I used my kindle to research how to get my coins back - it felt slower than ever. And please do not insult me with your generic blurb on how it removes hidden data and all that.
All this app did was scan my device, tell me I had a virus, and that I could buy another product 33% off on their link provided in order to fix it.

The problem with this is it does not do what it says, it does not clean  the kindle, at least not the free version.  It simply identifies problems and then says, "To remove the problems, pay us to activate the removal feature."  I, for one, do not appreciate bait and switch practices or false advertising.
Wouldn't clean anything without buying full package. Said I have 13 viruses, but another security app detects none

It appears to be a random number generator for the number of viruses found rather than actually finding viruses and removing them. No report at the end on the actual viruses removed, just a summary of the size of data held by your apps.  I tried it after not using the device for a day and it generates 4 viruses found. Clean it and try it again later that day, no viruses found. Go to the next day with no other usage and 7 viruses found. Clean it and try it again later that day, no viruses found. Go to the next day with no other usage and 3 viruses found. And on and on....  Seems like it's phony and just randomly generates a number each day.  Also doesn't have any place where you can update for the latest virus database so appears to be a scam.
I hate any app that says "free download" and after you download, you are asked to pay to actually make it function.  Be honest up front and don't waste our time.
Says "free" when you download it but it's not. You get charged once to do a scan.  My kindle still runs slow and freezes. Not so sure it's worth it.
It was ok.  Clunky interface. Makes you review it before it works.

I'm shocked that Amazon would even offer this app for sale. I will be attempting to get my money back. DO NOT BUY THIS!PS Aside from this tinyCam Monitor app annoyance, I'm really digging my new Fire TV Stick!

Headings: Not compatible w/ Night Owl Poseidon DVR 10
Base_Reviews: The Tiny Cam Pro can search network and I.D. my cams MAC addresses but cannot live view them. Tiny Cam setup has a Night Owl set up ref and notes say it's compatible (perhaps it is w/ some other model?), but Night Owl customer service told me it's not supported.

This app started locking up my Kindle Fire so bad I had to do a hard reset, plug/unplug the power cable, then do another hard reset again just to get my Kindle to unlock and come back on. After contacting the developer multiple times, I realised he just didn't care. I have two other relatives who had the same problem, so I know it isn't just my Kindle. Actually, I have three Kindles, so that's a total of FIVE so far it won't work on. This app is a total loss, renders my Kindle unusable, and the developer is one of the worst I've dealt with on Amazon. He won't even respond to my requests for help anymore. I finally had to uninstall this app and bought "Ip cam viewer" (full) and found no problems so far with that one. Take my advice, if you have a Kindle Fire, stay away from this app. I do have to add this, the app does work well on my Nexus 7 tablet, but it does NOT WORK ON KINDLE FIRE DEVICES. If you have another kind of tablet, it is a hit or miss, try the free version first. Better yet, if you have IP cameras and want to be able to choose from a list of good monitoring apps that work, don't buy a Kindle in the first place. Buy something else that will allow purchases from the Google Playstore. There is a better selection and most likely your device will be compatible with this app. Good luck.
This app does not work as advertised. It will also not support a DVR type of camera system. Don't waste your money

Headings: Waste of money for the app and time trying to ...
Base_Reviews: VERY difficult to use/setup. Never have gotten it to work with the Swann security cameras we have. Waste of money for the app and time trying to make it work. But if you want to look at random cameras around the world that have no description, this is for you! Because that is all that works.

I have used the Free version for over a year and it works great with my cameras.  I decided to purchase the Pro version because it offered "recording" capabilities over the snapshot function of the Free version.  Well, recording is not a video stream, it is just a series of jpg snapshots.  Not worth the upgrade as my cameras don't support motion detection or sound.  Oh well...Update: App now supports actual video recording.  But I am reducing the number of stars because the version of this app on the Amazon app store is at least 3 versions behind Playstore.

I got this app to use with my Fire TVs and at first it worked great.  However, I have since wasted many hours setting this up with the 16 D-link security cameras I have, only to see the app suddenly quit working and have to go through the whole process again.  I have uninstalled and reinstalled the app, fiddled with all the complicated settings, and am just tired of dealing with it now.  II am pretty tech savy but the aggravation just isn't worth it and I do NOT recommend this

Does a great job showing and controlling cameras.  Contacted support to have h264 support for my 933L.  They wanted to access the camera.  I set up a guest account, then they disappeared.  They have it for other models in the same line and their compatibility document says it is supported.  Without it, streaming is very slow.  So double check your compatible cameras.  Would give more stars but...

I bought this camera [...]. Based on the reviews, different brands/models are shipped to different people, and the one I got has absolutely no brand or model markings anywhere on the camera, included CD (and software on CD), or box. No instructions either. Using the Android app, IP Cam Viewer (a competitor for tinyCam Monitor), the camera brand and model came up automatically as "Unknown Brand", "IPCAM1,IPCAM2". Everything works perfectly in that app, connected on first try and hasn't had any problems since. I bought tinyCam Monitor Pro, since there was no way to actually try it out (the "test drive" amazon thing isn't going to work for actually seeing if the app will connect to a networked camera.... or at least, it wouldn't connect to mine), and I wanted to use the additional motion detection and recording features not found in IP Cam Viewer. However, I can't connect to the camera, I'm assuming since there is no comparable setting to the "Unknown Brand" option in IP Cam Viewer, and the app doesn't know how to communicate with it. Everything else is set the same as it is in IP Cam Viewer... same address, port, etc. I've tried all the camera brands/models that I've seen mentioned in the reviews for my camera, but I keep getting "Video Failed (socket closed)" and "Video Failed (404 - not found)" errors. So weak.

Don't buy this app.I wasted $4. App crashes on Fire TV stick, shuts itself off going back to home screen of Fire TV. I bought it to be able to watch kids sleep while working on a computer in the other room. It ended up being a big pain in the ass distraction, as every time I looked at the tv screen, app was gone, and I needed to pick up remote and restart it. Sometimes it worked for 5 minutes, other time only 1 minute.

First off, the motion alerts do not work unless the app is running in the background.  If the app is running, you can set it up to record automatically, but leaving it on will be at the expense of ram and battery life.I spent hours trying to get the app to work outside my home WIFI.  I figured out how to set the IP address on my camera so it is not dynamic, then figured out how to use port forwarding on my router, and had to set up a temporary DDNS address for my public IP just to make that happen.  It worked for two days, then a two second power outage reset something and I can't pull up feed on my phone anymore.  I dont feel like figuring it out at this point.The camera I'm using is a Foscam F19893P V2, for reference.The customer service is non existent.  I emailed them several times.  They only responded when I asked for a refund just to tell me I would not get one.The free foscam app that it came with works fine inside and outside my WIFI as long as my home internet is running and my phone has bars.  I wanted a a way to automatically record on motion, so I downloaded ISpy on my laptop for that.  It's a free open-source program.  Only issue is I have to leave my laptop on all the time until I come up with another solution.

Headings: Runs terrible on Fire TV Stick with HD cameras, acceptable on Gen I Fire tablet
Base_Reviews: Don't see too many reviews of this app for the 1st gen Fire TV stick and specific camera models so adding my experience here. Bought the app since I had good experience with it before on a 2012 Nexus 7 with Foscam 8910W (480P) cameras.Fast forward a few years and i've since added Foscam 9821 (720P) and Amcrest IP2M-841 (1080P) cameras as well and thought over the weekend that it would be nice to be able to see the cams on a large TV via the Fire TV stick.Checked the amazon app store and saw that the app is listed as compatible so without hesitation I bought it given the good experience before. First the good, the scan feature is very good and picked up IP addresses, custom ports, camera make, model correctly for the most part so all I had to do was confirm cameras and enter user name and password. There was a bit of a learning curve to using the fire tv remote to navigate but do able.Now the bad, the 480p cameras worked fine as expected getting about 14-15 fps which is in line with MJPEG camera frame rates; video is reasonably smooth. The 720p cameras were disappointing at 9-10 fps, we're in choppy video territory here now. The 1080p camera was inexcusably bad at ~4 fps, we're talking someone walking across the room looks like they are teleporting 3ft forward at a time. This is all using the built in app's hardware acceleration setting.I reached out to support and he advised that the Fire TV is slow hardware and essentially to lower my resolution on the camera or get better hardware like an Nvidia shield. The Fire TV stick while slow overall can play 1080P videos from Amazon, Netflix, Plex, etc so I think I was somewhat reasonable in my expectation that H264 cameras would work fine with the hardware provided but I guess I was wrong.I will try limiting the app to one camera next to see if that improves the performance.Edit Mar 2017:Removed all the 480P cameras and now only have 2 cameras connected to the app: one 720P Foscam and one 1080P Amcrest, FPS has now improved when in full screen mode: 720P camera fluctuates between 6-10 FPS but seems to stabilize out around 10 FPS, still choppy video overall but usuable as a baby cam and not for any kind of detailed viewing/recording, 1080P camera seems to stabilize around 14-16 FPS and under low motion appears reasonably smooth but again not what you'd want for detailed viewing/recording.When both cameras are on screen in the multicam view, both slow down to about 7 FPS and basically unusable past the point of a series of slow moving pictures but if all you need is any kind of visual like a camera in the garage to verify if the door is open or closed....it'll do.I have the app running on 2 1st gen Fire TV sticks bought at the same time; one seems to like the HW+ decoding better and the other does better in HW mode. Same app, same generation hardware, same cameras, perhaps there are hardware differences inside?The moment I try adding the 480P cameras back in the mix, performance suffers again. I also tried using with just the 1080P cam and it only picked up another 1-2 FPS.Installed the app on a Gen I Fire tablet as well and using with only the 1080P camera in HW mode, am getting 30 FPS in daylight but expect that IR performance at night will likely suffer as well.Conclusion: use with 2 H264 cameras at most on a Gen I Fire TV stick and Gen I Fire tablet. If you have the hardware already like I did, it's ok value to get a little bit of extra utility out of them.

Headings: Limited group of compatible cameras, Since my all of ...
Base_Reviews: Limited group of compatible cameras, Since my  all of different IP cameras were not on the list, I found it impossible to add any of them manually.

Headings: Overpowers Fire TV Stick very quickly ... frequent crashes
Base_Reviews: So the configuration process was fairly straight forward and I got 2 of my Wyze Cam Pan's to stream side by side to my firestick in live view.  However, that was about it.  From there it constantly would crash or lock up my fire stick.  it only has about 6 GB of storage total so I removed almost all of my other apps leaving just about 4-5 GB of storage available.  I tried all the forum tricks to improve performance but I think it's just too much for this 2nd Gen Fire TV Stick.  So unfortunately I now have to buy the app again through the amazon play store so I can emulate Android OS via BlueStacks and run it off my PC.

Headings: Great app for your phone...not so much the FireTV Stick
Base_Reviews: I have this app for my android phone and I LOVE IT, but on the Fire TV Stick....it totally sucks. The Fire TV Stick is basically just Android, so the app that is on the FireTV is the exact same app you would have on your phone, minus some features.I don't know if it's a limitation of the FireTV Stick or what, but the video skips like crazy, it's poor quality. On my phone it looks amazing. I'm guessing this issue a lot has to do with RAM or maybe CPU speed. Because the app on my tablet also has skippy video.The app needs better controls for using it on the TV.
Did not seem useful and used a lot of memory.

Headings: Works on phones, nukes Kindle Fire
Base_Reviews: A year ago, this app was great. Worked on Android phones and Kindle Fires alike. Loved the controls, features, and performance of it. You can backup your data, share it, and even send screenshots from the camera. Really cool stuff.At some point in the last year, however, an update came out that rendered the app useless on the Kindle Fire. It opens, loads live view, then proceeds to freeze - and when I say freeze - the whole device locks up, requiring a hard reset.I've now tried this on 2 Fires - one which is rooted and running a fresh Jelly Bean ROM - so its not the Kindle OS. Something with this app does not jive with the hardware, and now I'm out $4. Very, very irritating.

Headings: Looks like I should of bought just a regular old baby ...

This app freezes every night... very disappointing... Looks like I should of bought just a regular old baby video monitor.
Although it works with my camera - the interface times out and crashes.  Want to use for a crib monitor on a bedroom tv (via FireTV Stick) but it crashes after about 30 minutes of use or freezes.

Headings: Absolutely horrible interface and regular crashing
Base_Reviews: I have had this service for over 8 months.  In that time, the amount of recorded shows that had technical difficulties and crashed without recording the rest of the episode or having to start all over and find where it crashed is substantial.  And they only carry the locally covered NHL games so if you are a hockey fan, this is a terrible option.  Ultimately, this service drove me nuts and was extremely more frustration than an actual "service".  The only benefit it had over some other services (ie. Youtube TV) is that they are actual recordings that you can fast forward and skip commercials (as long as it doesn't crash the interface which happens regularly).  Otherwise, trying to figure out how to run the interface was and still is a complete nightmare.  At least on an LG smart TV.  I have to scroll up to get to a menu 6 or 7 times before it actually does it.  The UI is completely unintuitive and a nightmare to figure out.  Even when you finally figure out the completely unintuitive actions you have to take to pull up a menu while watching a show, you have to do it over and over and over before it actually does it.  The frustration level with this service is way beyond what its worth at one of the highest price points of all streaming services.  I highly recommend anyone who's considering this to just move on to the next service on your list.  This one is terrible.

Headings: FuboTV's free trial is a scam beware.
Base_Reviews: FuboTV's free trial is a scam beware.I signed up for a 7-day trial to test out the service and then I find out I've been charged $90 because I inadvertently clicked the wrong subscription button that apparently the free trial didn't apply to. All of the screens in the application were in Spanish and since I don't speak Spanish I had no idea what I was clicking. There was no setting to change the language. I contacted their support and they said sorry you're on the hook for the $90. All I want is a refund. Their trial period is completely misleading. In any business, how is this a good way to try and cultivate a new user? Avoid this company!!!

An extremely lacking streaming service, buffering even when I have 1gig internet and was running Ethernet from my modem to Chromecast. Canceled my "trial" due to the awful interface and having games randomly cut off during the last 8 minutes. In live sports, those are moments you'll never get back and paying 70 a month for garbage like that is tragic. Needless to say Fubo wasn't done with me there. They decided to reactive my account with my permission 3 month later and just start billing me a fluctuating price form 65-75 a month. Sadly it took me 5 month to notice due to a high tempo life in the military. Once I reached out and asked for an explanation their original response was pretty much. "well our system created a second account and it's been over 24 hours so we can cancel now and you'll have it until the end of the month" - mind you, I've been traveling and out of a house for 4 months and haven't even turned a TV or tried to stream any sports the entire time, and if I ever wanted to, I would have given my money to anyone other then FUBOTV. Ludicrous that this is still an allowed business.

When I tried to load the fubo app on my fire tv I was directed, on the TV screen, to a phone number for assistance in completing the installation. I called the number and the answering party identified himself as a fubo customer service agent. In the course of "assisting" me he had me connect via my computer to a site I later found out was a remote control app.  During the rest of the installation my computer was hacked and various attempts were made access my bank accounts. Fraudulent transactions were conducted with online merchants and using my credit card information.  Because my computer was hacked I had to buy a new one and close my credit card accounts.Fubo customer service declined to answer messages from me about the incident after I informed them of all that had occurred.

It is nearly impossible to find a channel that Fubo streams inside the interface. Searching is horrific, the experience is awful, and it's extremely hard to navigate. I would never purchase this service because of how awful it is.

I was talked into switching to FUBO last year. I looked at the channel line up and noticed that none of the Turner stations were available at any price. Knowing that the NCAA Final Four was going to be telecast on TBS, I questioned the customer service rep about this omission. I was assured that this station would be added in plenty of time for the tournament. It turned out to be a lie. Fubo has no intention of broadcasting the biggest sporting event in the nation to its 1.3 million subscribers. Here is a streaming service that advertises itself as a sports specialist not able to broadcast the Final Four! I'm switching tomorrow!ission.

I would not recommend. Using this app turned out to be a disaster for my business. I've been using this for over a year, so all of my customers and business contacts have my TextMe number as my contact. Randomly and suddenly, TextMe stopped allowing me to send/receive texts and calls. I submitted a help ticket. After 8 days, I received a response from LaKeitha that offers zero resolution and is accusatory about the cause of the problem. I have only used this service to call and text, no strange attachments or seedy material. I can't imagine what my usage crime would've been, but LaKeitha apparently doesn't either nor does she care. So, now all of my business contacts are contacting me at a number that is no longer valid and I have no idea what communications I am missing. Here is her response "Our security system is equipped with automation that flags accounts that are violating our Terms & Conditions.Because it is automatic, we cannot see the reason for the block, nor are we able to determine if and when the account(s) will be available for use again in the future. Please note, you agreed to the Terms & Conditions upon creating your account(s). It is up to you to review, and comply with them fully.Sorry we do not have anything further to share at this time."

Headings: Not compatible w/ Night Owl Poseidon DVR 10
Base_Reviews: The Tiny Cam Pro can search network and I.D. my cams MAC addresses but cannot live view them. Tiny Cam setup has a Night Owl set up ref and notes say it's compatible (perhaps it is w/ some other model?), but Night Owl customer service told me it's not supported.

This app started locking up my Kindle Fire so bad I had to do a hard reset, plug/unplug the power cable, then do another hard reset again just to get my Kindle to unlock and come back on. After contacting the developer multiple times, I realised he just didn't care. I have two other relatives who had the same problem, so I know it isn't just my Kindle. Actually, I have three Kindles, so that's a total of FIVE so far it won't work on. This app is a total loss, renders my Kindle unusable, and the developer is one of the worst I've dealt with on Amazon. He won't even respond to my requests for help anymore. I finally had to uninstall this app and bought "Ip cam viewer" (full) and found no problems so far with that one. Take my advice, if you have a Kindle Fire, stay away from this app. I do have to add this, the app does work well on my Nexus 7 tablet, but it does NOT WORK ON KINDLE FIRE DEVICES. If you have another kind of tablet, it is a hit or miss, try the free version first. Better yet, if you have IP cameras and want to be able to choose from a list of good monitoring apps that work, don't buy a Kindle in the first place. Buy something else that will allow purchases from the Google Playstore. There is a better selection and most likely your device will be compatible with this app. Good luck.
